Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
I just visited Gujarat bhawan restaurant at 11 kautilya marg, new Delhi
It is run by Mohani caterers. 
The food was horrible. 
Tasteless. 
Cold. 
Nothing to say about Gujarati touch, expect dal was sweet to say it was Gujarati dal. I will certainly not recommend...it to anyone. 
It brings bad name to Gujarati food.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Food was very nice and quantity was also apt. Plus the price did not disappoint as well. Enjoyed my time here.

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
I absolutely loved the Gujarati food served at this canteen. Best part is food was hot, authentic and you have unlimited thali. Boy I just loved this deadly combination.

The place around the Gujarati restaurant is awesome due to embassies nearby, plus the restaurant also...is a/c with nice seating and it is quite well off for a canteen. They provide pure vegetarian meals in the form of unlimited thali - normal thali and a deluxe thai. 

They have  Fafda Jalebi etc too besides thali that you can get in. Dont forget to carry a govt valid id proof while vising here as you need to make an entry in the visitor register.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: The meal was great with authentic Gujarati thali. Love the atmosphere and the food. It is difficult to get such a nice meal out of the native place. Got the Gujrati experience out of Gujarat..! Love it

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Located in centre of the city.This place provides Gujarati Cusine.
This place serves Thali for lunch and dinner,though doesnot have authentic taste.
It serves the purpose!!

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: In Delhi, the best place where one could relish Gujarati dishes. Recently renovated it has a neat and clean dinning area. They serve pure vegetarian meals in the form of unlimited thali which includes a variety of items. Chhas, Khichdi, Kadhi, Dhokla, Fafda Jalebi is...just awesome. They have a good service.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Very good restaurant, homely food, feeling like eating  in home, very reasonable priced, must visit for everyone

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: This restaurant in chankyapuri was very good serving simple Gujarati food. They renovated the place sometime back and after that though the dinner area has become spacious the quality of food has gone down badly.The service standards has also come down it is very disappointing...to see this state.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We went on a Sunday evening so there was a waiting period of about 20 mins. Basically they serve unlimited thali two types, difference is one has sweet dish and one farsaan in addition to food. They serve one dal ine dry n one wet...veg kichidi dhokla roti, bajra roti etc. Prices are very reasonable . Please note this is not a fine dine place but a a little bit more than canteen . But worth one visit atleast. Dinner rs120 normal n rs 155 deluxe thaali.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Thali was great and the staff were lovely.
Detail Review:
What a lovely area this restaurant is in. Its great for anyone who wants to eat Gujarati food and has a very home like feel. 

Right in the diplomatic district it is nested away behind a big admin building. Very simple in its set up...and its layout but thats all you want. Its clean, Fantastic quality food and the staff super welcoming. 

The Thali has different sabji and the khadi and kitchadi was ace. As much Rotli as i wanted and the chaas and papad were just lovely. 

Would definitely come back. Felt like home away from home.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Excellent veg. Food, very friendly staff - restaurant is a kind of a cantine for people working in this complex, full meal for 160 INR.

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We had dinner at the Gujarati Restaurant on the Kautilya Marg at Gujarath Bhavan. The food was very well prepared and served also with lot of affection. The quality of preparation was excellent and finally when the bill was received it was a surprise that...for 3 of us it was under 500 rupees. We had stayed at Samrat and this place is a stone throw away from Samrat. It was a good experience.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: The ambience of this restaurant is delightful.  The staff are cheerful and friendly.  Went for Lunch they have two types of Vegetarian Gujarati Thalis.  I had the simply Thali and it was excellent.  Food was served hot and tasty.  Great place also to meet people....When you consider in food courts in Delhi Thali cost twice as much as well, its definitely a great bargain.More

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Gujarati Resturant is the best option for veg. they provide best meal facility in affordable price.i really loving that place and its really appreciable....!!! FIVE STARS

Name: GUJARATI RESTURANT, New Delhi - Chanakyapuri/Lutyens' Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Best veg Gujarati Break fast in Delhi
Detail Review:
A simple & calm place to have best Gujarati break fast in Delhi. Authentic taste & best quality preparation make it stand apart. Pocket friendly despite best location & good food.
Fafada, Jalebi, Thepala, Dhokala, Poha truely Guuju taste. Gujarati thali for dinner & lunch....Must visit place in DelhiMore

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Fabulous breakfast to start the day
Detail Review: Wonderful choice of Indian and Western breakfast fare. Ranging from north indian parathas to south indian idlis as well as local Varanasi dishes as well as fresh fruit, salads, juices and yogurts for the health conscious, you will be spoilt for choice. The staff is...very courteous and helpful. Pradipto and Nibha especially.More

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Delicious buffet. Kind staffs especially hostess Nibha, durgesh nitish and all palate staff. Lovely ambience.

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Mamorable exprience in palate restaurant at breakfast
Detail Review: The food was delicious, stay was nice, and staff was too cooperative and friendly. I would like to thank especially Miss Nibha Mr nikhil and nitish also.

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Great food and nice experience with Nibha
Detail Review: Service and food was great. Staff was too friendly and cooperative especially miss Nibha Nilam durgesh and Ajay.  That was highly recommended  for next visit.

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We had breakfast and dinner. Quality of the food is excellent. All staff were courteous and attentive. Would recommend.
Mr.Anand in particular was very nice and made us feel at home.

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Nice Experience in palate restaurants with the staff especially Nibha and Durgesh
Detail Review: The staff here makes all the difference…very kind and helpful.  The meals were outstanding and had great variety.  Cleanliness and food safety was a high priority for them and it was appreciated.  Would highly recommend!

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: A wide spread of amazing dishes for breakfast a wonderful experience of prompt service and helpful staff Mr durgesh a d anand were at their best in serving us and miss Nibha was always there to help us

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Outstanding spread of the breakfast. Very delicious. Nice hospitality. Local food was also there. Totally recommended

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Good service and variety of Indian and western cuisine. We had breakfast two days in a row and there was a nice change in the Indian spread. Black coffee is recommended

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Best place to stay with family
Detail Review: The food is awesome and the hospitality of the staff is very good.  The environment in the hotel as well as in the restaurant is very good

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Good food to fill you up, great service and smiling staff. Also the hot stations have a good selection

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We have enjoyed the most lavish, tasty, healthy and tempting breakfast. The staff is very polite and helpful 
Thank you Nibha and Chef Murli for making all of us do some serious over eating. 
We will keep coming back

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Nice service in the palate at breakfast
Detail Review: Breakfast was very nice....... staff was too cooperative.   Hostess Nivha was very polite. Service was excellent by the Mr Nitish Rahul and anjum. I would like to thank especially for all palate staff who was serving me at the Breakfast and dinner

Name: THE PALATE AT RAMADA PLAZA BY WYNDHAM JHV VARANASI - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: The staff and services were amazing. They serve your food to your table even with buffet. We stayed for 4 days. Staff members Roma, Anjum the host greet and service with a smile on their faces at all times. Coming from USA, the service levels...were just amazing.More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: A decent place to live the history.
Detail Review: This is a must visit place if you are in Chail to have a look at Maharaja of Patiala (bhupindea singh’s) royal summer retreat. It is vintage , even the restaurant is the same with Indian and snacks options but tastes good. Overall it’s a...good place to enjoy sunset , have a walk , learn about history and get amazed by the huge maharani’s paintings .More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Staff is very arrogant and confused while alloting rooms. Must be trained properly to handle guests

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Sadly, a fascinating legacy has been neglected to the extent that the rooms smell musty, the dining room seems unused and the general staff uninterested. The lawns are quite beautiful but there is no water in the fountains and a pathetic little outdoor cafe, exuding...a feeling of lack of funds for upkeep. May the structure be rescued by a private party!More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We had tea there which was. Good ,just like old times,cutlet and toast .
Tasty food.old architecture.staff was responsive

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Not as majestic as it once was , run down condition
Detail Review:
It is not as majestic as it once was, It is in a run down condition .
Visitors entry is RS 200 per person but this only gives access to the ground floor / limited rooms 
The Palace has some good walking trails to the...cottages and surrounding area , which one should exploreMore

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Pathetic and waste of time and money
Detail Review: The restaurant is typical “Sarkari” place with zero hospitality. I waited for 1 hour but no one attended. Pathetic. Instead go to Janedghat and have home cooked desi ghee food at Sharma dhaba

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We visited Chail Palace on July 24 when we stayed at ITC Tavleen in Chail. As soon as you enter the Palace a musty smell hits you. There is an air of disinterest and disrepair. Carpets are dirty, dining hall is closed. There’s a small...shop selling Himachal woollens in a corner.

What is interesting are the few pictures on the wall and the history of the palace. The building seems sturdy and the lawns are quite large and could be very beautiful if maintained properly. 

The Palace needs to be beautified. The view from the palace is beautiful. One can see Shimla though we c oh LC not as it was raining. Wish someone could restore its majesty!More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Great place to grab a meal post completing the Chail Palace visit... While there is no one to help with table management (especially since the restaurant gets busy pretty quickly), the staff is courteous and serve you well.

The food portions and taste is amazing...too - We ordered a mix of Indian, Continental and Chinese (since we were travelling with small kids) and all were equally well made and tasty!!! 

Not to forget it was also good Value For Money!!!More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: The staff is very efficient and the food is good. It makes sense to go when there is no weekend rush. The only issue is that unlike most places today, this place does not have anyone to manage the queue when the restaurant is experiencing...heavy rush. They expect you to find a seat on your own as and when the tables get vacated.More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Amazing place to spend time. Excellent restaurant. A day trip is also worth the visit. nothing more to add

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
A lovely Heritage property and the upkeep shows. Clean and each piece of furniture so well kept. 
Loved the food at the Restaurant. The shaslik and sizzler was absolute value for money and served so well. Such a pleasure to be served by such polite...staff.More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Doesn't complement the property, small size, sometime feels like a local restaurant only, grossly ill-equipped.

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Had lunch with family today. This restaurant was stongly recommended for its himachali dishes. Very well maintained restaurant with a Royal ambience. Staff is well trained and polite. Tried their anardana chicken and  methi  naan  amongst other dishes which were outstanding. Reasonably priced this place...is a must visit if you are in chail.More

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: This isn't a palace by any measure - it's a decorated gift shop. Such a waste of time to come here and explore.

Name: CHAIL PALACE RESTURANT - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Loved the hospitality of the restaurant staff
Detail Review: We just popped in for some lunch and i loved how courteous the staff of the restaurant was. Food was great.

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Quote: Front Sea View Restaurent in Varkala
Detail Review:
Sea Front View Restaurent with excellent food, great service and above all Manager Rocky who takes cares of each and every guest personally,very humble polite thorough gentleman gem of Sunrise Restaurant.
Even though it was packed all the time during weekend but they took care...nicely.
I had a great time at Sunrise visited few times for my lunch and dinner.i highly recommended  Sunrise Restaurent Varkala.More

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Detail Review:
Excellent place
Great atmosphere

The place to be in varkala cliff

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Quote: My long lasting memories in Sunrise
Detail Review: That was one of my most beautiful days ever. I'm at a loss for words to describe my time in Sunrise. Extraordinary cuisine, a stay that will transport you to nature, and excellent service. Thank you very much for the lovely "Sunrise" I experienced.

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Quote: A perfect place for your pleasure trip
Detail Review: It was a great experience. The ambiance was very charming and the food was so delicious. My special gratitude to the staffs, for their perfect service and their helping mentality on making better choices. I am definitely visit Sunrise again and again. Thanks a lot.

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Quote: MOST BEAUTIFUL SUN RISE AND SUN SET IN MY LIFE
Detail Review: My favourite sunrise and sunset in my life with ‘Sunrise’. I can assure you that Sunrise is a perfect destination for food lovers.  I forgot about my entire diet plan and tried different types of food. It is not enough to glorify Sunrise, who gave...us a perfect sight that pleases the eye.More

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: No words to explain. We enjoyed a ton. You guys made my trip utmost happiness. Great food and service. Trust me guys, you will have your best sunrise and sunset at 'Sunrise.'

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: Wow!!! That was awesome. I enjoyed it a lot. You guys made my trip so fabulous in all ways. As you have said, the food has evoked my whole senses. Thanks a lot to ‘Sunrise’.

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review:
Very good atmosphere and ambience
Good Seaview and spacious inside
Indian, tibetian, chinese, continental foods are also availabe
Candle light dinner in night
Good for couples and familes.

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Quote: A view point restaurant in varkala.
Detail Review: Nice and delicious food was served, even price also affordable. Good place to spend with family best food and nice time to spend as well

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Quote: Good vibes,nice food and great service.
Detail Review: One of the best restaurants in varkala. One time u go then u always going to that restaurant. That was their service and food.

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review:
The food quality and service was getting worse (yes they managed !) since new management started running the place for 2019/2020 touristic season.
Unfortunately (for the staff) and for fortunately (for guests and other restaurants), the manager took all the money, did not pay his...lenders and escaped to Nepal.
This place is no moreMore

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: The second best Tibetan in my opinion. Little Tibet far superior. Food was tasty but portions weren’t huge. Prices average for tourist oriented cliff

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: We return again to this great restaurant with its wonderful views. The excellent food is served by very friendly and helpful staff who always have a smile and will explain the various dishes and choice of delicious fresh fish. We recommend Sunrise Restaurant to all...ages and all nationalities. Good value for money.More

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: Stuff is helpful and foods are really delicious. First time came here, loved it.Recommended here :))

Name: SUNRISE RESTURANT, Varkala Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: Went in here randomly as we were walking past - at first we didn't know what to expect but we were impressed with the food - we had 2 egg fried noodles, I veg potatoes & cheese momo, mango lassi and cold coffee - it...all came to around rs.750 - the portions were big and the food was very tasty :) it was overlooking the cliff and you get nice views of the beach from the window facing tables :)More

Name: SINDHUKANYA VEG RESTURANT, Mandarmani - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Not so good and not so clean and food quality was not upto the mark as expected. Soo spicy and cost is very high. Not recommended

Name: SINDHUKANYA VEG RESTURANT, Mandarmani - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Good food in reasonable price. You will not have a variety of options, though you can choose food from their fix menu.

Name: SINDHUKANYA VEG RESTURANT, Mandarmani - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: They serve tasty food price little bit higher.quality was good.roti was not up to mark.they provide veg and non veg.

Name: BALLAL RESIDENCY RESTURANT, Bengaluru - Richmond Town - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Quote: One of the best masale dosa !!
Detail Review:
If you are a fan of red garlic chutney smeared inside crispy dosa with spicy chutney and tangy sambhar...then this is the place to go!!..
The hotel is situated next to community...and has an old charm bengaluru ambience. 
There is ample space for parking and...outdoor seating is also available.
It is quite peaceful and one can have a relaxing meal. 
Now coming to the food part, the masale dosa was very good as it had all the ingredients to make a perfect crispy and tasty dosa. The rava idli was soft unlike in many restaurants and the pav bhaji was decent. Unfortunately the gobi manchurian was not that great.
Overall its a great place to hang out for friends and family over a meal.

P.S beautiful looking thalis are also available, which we didnt order. Hopefully the taste will also be good ..More

It’s a spacious restaurant , simple and clean interiors , Uniformed and well behaved staff with...a professional hospitable countenance.

This has almost all Of vegetarian dishes with a tinge of mangalore cuisine style.

Detail Review: I had been to this restaurant on 22nd Dec’18 for lunch with family. The ambiance is interesting.. the service is timely and good. Name: ROOTS RESTURANT, Bengaluru - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Visited this place last night as i always like this place, and therefore decided to go here with family. We reached there around 8.30pm and being a weekday the place was still crowded but we got a table.
It has 2 floors of sitting, the...ambiance of this place is very nice with dim lights and nicely done infrastructures. We sat on the first floor, we asked the chef for recommendations, to which he suggested veg dahi ke kebab in starters and 1 crispy roll he made for us stuffed with paneer and cheese and were really nice in taste, even dahi ke kebab was awesome. A must try just melt in the mouth.
For main course we ordered a mix pasta, fried rice and veg Manchurian . Pasta was amazing really nice in taste, and even fried rice and Manchurian were yummy. Apart from this we had a melon mocktail, virgin mojito they were nice too.
Service here is good but sometimes, it was like we ordered something but nobody turned up for some time, and when we asked they were like they even didn't know.
So the service needs to be improved at this point,More

Name: ROOTS RESTURANT, Bengaluru - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Detail Review: One of the very good value for money places around kormangla region. The starters are exceptionally good and Dal makhani is the closest Delhisque taste here. Would definitely suggest this place for family and corporate outings alike

Name: ROOTS RESTURANT, Bengaluru - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Have been to this place quite a few times before too, but those were for official meetings. This time, had a dinner plan with friends here, and how we loved it!

So, this place has a rustic décor , with soothing music in background, making...it more suitable for sit down dinners/lunches. We tried almost all the items since we were a big group of 10, and glad to say, almost all of them impressed us barring just a few!

We started with the Watermelon and Feta salad, fresh in it’s own way, and presented beautifully(the small round scoops of watermelon with sprinkled feta cheese was a visual delight too); followed by the Mullagawatany soup(a thick lentil based soup) for the vegetarians, and the Hot and Sour one for the non-vegetarians in the group. Both the soups had set the standard high.

Next came up their Stuffed Paneer Tikka(had a stuffing of dry fruits), post which came up their famous Dahi k Kebab; we could never imagine that one could get these typical North Indian delicacies cooked to perfection in Bangalore! Extremely soft, well bound and melt in the mouth types, this one was the favorite amongst all. The Chicken tikka that we had was okayish. Actually we were too happy with the veg ones, for a change.

For main course, we have their Dal Makhni, Paneer Khurchan, Mangalore style Prawns curry with Rice, Chicken Ghee Roast with Appam. To be noted here, their Dal Makhni is an extremely safe bet, very well made, it went well with the accompanying breads. But the Chicken ghee roast was disappointing; it did not have the authentic Mangalorean flavor at all; but if you take it as a normal chicken preparation, then it would be fine, but definitely not a ghee roast. The Mangalore style Prawns was quite good, and we belted it off with rice.

After all this, we just wanted couple of deserts and went for the Fried icecream, the regular Mud Pie and Malpua with Rabri(best one).

The best part of this place is their very reasonable pricing. They also offer 2+2 n drinks, courtesy Zomato gold. Highly recommended for group lunches/dinners!More

Name: ROOTS RESTURANT, Bengaluru - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:

Name: GURUKRIPA RESTURANT, Maheshwar - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: As restaurant options In Maheshwar are so limited, we sought out Guru Kripa based on TA reviews.  From the outside there was very little indication that it was a restaurant and  even though we were standing in front of it, we had to ask.  We...entered and went directly  into an empty small room with one long table.  Eventually a young man came and we ordered two thalis.  After a long wait, the waiter brought us empty thali trays.  A few minutes later he served us dal, veg, something else, pickle and chapati.  Rice came much later.  The quality was so-so, but it was quite cold.  However we could eat as much as we wanted as he left the serving dishes for us to help ourselves.  This is not a restaurant for everyone.  It's at the bus stand and serves folks who want an easy meal.   65/ea.More

Name: GURUKRIPA RESTURANT, Maheshwar - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: The food is delicious, delicious, delicious
Detail Review: Maheshwar's dining options are limited, but almost anyone you ask recommends Gurukripa. Walk down the entire bazaar road to the talkies junction, cross over to the bus-stop side, look for small place called Gurukripa on the left, enter and take a seat.  Don’t be dissuaded...by the humble appearance of the place, instead let your tastebuds play judge for a change. I had the tastiest north-Indian food in my life there. Ever. The food is really at a different level, and an unlimited thali costs an incredibly reasonable 60 rupees (like, 1 dollar). I returned there for every meal during my stay, and despite always being the only woman in the room no one stared or passed idiotic comments, they were in fact least interested. I can’t decide whether that says a lot about me, or speaks well of them, or just points to the level the food reaches – maybe it’s all three.  The restaurant is run by two polite, smiling Sardar brothers and their father. They refill your plate with hot rotis and vegtables and dal before you need it, and persuade you to have a little more when you refuse any more food ("ek aur roti to lijiye") - true Punjabi hospitality. I spotted a clean and orderly kitchen, the food is served hot and fresh, the menu changes completely for lunch and dinner, leaving me with no worries about falling ill later.  I don't know how they make a profit at that rate. I suspect they don't.More

Name: ANNALAKSHMI RESTAURANT, Chennai (Madras) - Nungambakkam - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Review of Anna Lakshmi fine dining restaurant on Spurtank Road Chennai
Detail Review:
I had the opportunity of writing a detailed review  on this Annalakshmi restaurant on 6th Oct 2022 , post covid.

Today my family and I  had lunch at Annalakshmi along with our family doctor and his wife  on the eve of his 76th  birthday ....When ever I step into this Annalakshmi Restaurant my  memory  always goes to Shri Ramani Guruji aka Swamy Santhanand Saraswathi,  who used to receive diners personally with a warm smile standing  at the entrance to  Annalakshmi restaurant , which  opened out in Chennai opposite LIC in Mount Road ,several decades ago .

In those days food served in his  Annalakshmi restaurant  was mainly prepared by  of his ardent  devotees  comprising of mostly  professionals and  houswives .They used to 
Cook excellent food at home as per age old recipes akin to their own  mother's cooking  and bring it over to the restaurant to serve it to guests as  dedication to Guruji and his charitable  missions.
 
But In this restaurant now  located in their own building on spurtank Road, these days high quality  food is churned out everyday in their modern kitchen , by a team of dedicated and loyal chefs who are all well trained by the same  Swamiji's disciples years ago , in the art of traditional  recipes they used to make at home and serve in the Mount Road  restaurant ,when Swamiji was around .

It's note worthy to hear  that , even today a few old disciples still do step in to provide fresh inputs to their Chefs of many years .

This restaurant has been designed  to perfection by the proffessional devotees  with pleasing art decor and dining in cool  Ac comfort here is indeed a real pleasure .

This premise has  adequate carparking 
and includes a  party hall in 2nd level for  conduct of small family functions like sashtiapthapoorthy, 
Birthdays ,upanayanam etc .

Looking at the large number of senior citizens among their diners , I am sure the
Food served here must  certainly be very comforting  to most  .

Dear friends , you don't have to take my word  when I mention that  there is no restaurant in Chennai  which serves south Indian thali meals with such high quality & finesse, that is sure to thrill  any diner from across the globe.

You can check it out for yourself,  but please do so through advance booking .

What will catch the attention of diners will surely be the artistic  ambience ,cleanliness, hospitality with smile by volunteers and culinary taste at its best and  wide spread of items  included in  their thali  everyday .

Director Shri Aravind  and his family is always around to supervise the operation every day .

I for one,  am able to  appreciate the
tremendous efforts their dedicated team puts  into selection and sourcing  of fresh  vegetables ,condiments and other items for daily cooking of sathvic food  served here  in traditional style ,without  use off any cold storage facilities .

I also appreciate the wonderful gesture extended by the management  to their entire team of volunteers by making sure they are provided with good food in the  restaurant itself , before service starts for  guests. 

The management I understand also  takes care of their children's education of needed .

Dining here is indeed a wonderful experience and one can notice  smiles  in the face of every  diner, who exits this  restaurant after a joyful meal. !More

Name: ANNALAKSHMI RESTAURANT, Chennai (Madras) - Nungambakkam - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Annalakshmi is a temple themed vegetarian restaurant offering North and South Indian cuisine. The place has an excellent décor, ambience seating and seating. We went there for a family dinner after due reservation and enjoyed their Mahalakshmi Preethi Bhojan where we were served a sumptuous...meal leisurely at our pace. It comprised of a Soup, Starters, Dal, Paneer Sabji, Rice Pulao, Sambar, Rasam, Kuzhambu, Rice preparations, Curd Rice, Pickle and finally desserts such as Payasam, Gulab Jamun and Ice Cream.  The entire meal was fresh, well cooked, not spicy and delicious. The staff are courteous, helpful and great. A great evening.More

Name: ANNALAKSHMI RESTAURANT, Chennai (Madras) - Nungambakkam - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: ANNALAKSHMI RESTAURANT, Chennai (Madras) - Nungambakkam - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Review of Annalakshmi restaurant @ No 6  Mayor Ramanathan Road, Chennai.
Detail Review:
Today I had the opportunity to dine in this temple of culinary delight called 
Annalaksmi .
I believe this restaurant is  driven by divine forces,  perhaps because  its name itself  is  derived from goddess Lakshmi for Annam or food,  not to mention the fact that...its blessed by its founder Swami Shanthanand Saraswathi aka to some fondly as Ramani guruji,  himself a disciple of swami Sivanandha of Risihikesh.

Trust me this is just not a restaurant that serves south Indian and north indian food as fine dining at its best but an institution that serves the community at large through art and free health care  through their charitable institution spread across 4 countries namely Singapore Malaysia Australia and India .The revenues generated from this restaurant along with other public donations goes to sustain their charitable  efforts 
I still have fond memories of Guruji standing at the entrance of Annalakshmi,  when he started this restaurant way back in 80's on Anna salai opposite famous iconic LIC building and receiving his guests with a smile in true indian vedic tradition of " Athithi devo bhava" while his retinue of disciples comprising of  professionals and housewives would  volunteer and prepare homely food in the kitchen and  serve  the  guests to this  restaurant .

The idea of a  charitable movement to serve community at large was  born in swamiji's mind and in  1984 in Jalan Bangsar Baru , Kaulalumpur , Malaysia  Annalakshmi restaurant came into being and spread from there to Singapore  India and Australia .
Swamiji's idea was  to bring togather the culinary skills of mothers and grandmothers among  his group of disciples who have been feeding their loved ones with tender care  dedication.

Swamiji wanted to draw upon their heritage  skills of creating delightful & nutritious nourishments  from fresh ingradients sourced on daily basis avoiding any inputs from any cold storages facilities .

Swamiji empowered these housewives to serve the larger family of the community through their homely skills honed through traditions and practices .

But today there are proffessional chefs who churn out the same food with same fine taste , after  being trained by swamiji's  disciples .

In simple words Annalakshmi is like  one's own home where one can go to eat to their  hearts content while enjoying  themselves in plush ,luxurious and artistically created environment .
The  payment you make is  not just  for the great food served in true hospitality  but also to help their chatitable trust to sustain  their good work both in fine arts  and free  health care centres .

This restaurant is presently managed well by Mr Aravind and his other family members , all of whom I understand are disciples of swamiji .

To their credit , they have now started another restaurant and sweet shop named Mayur next to this Annalakshmi restaurant  under the aegis of the same trust .
For those wanting to have a family function , party or an event , the restaurant in its present own location offers two floors for holding them with a capacity to serve 500 people .

Dining in Annalakshmi is an experience one will never forget and to those travellers from other countries I say this ." If you want to experience true south Indian culture , hospitality and  its fine culinary delights look nowhere else .Head straight to Annalakshmi restaurant. 
It will be an experience you will cherish and take back fond memories of having enjoyed great meal with full satisfaction ."More

Name: ANNALAKSHMI RESTAURANT, Chennai (Madras) - Nungambakkam - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: VARR - TEMPLE FOOD OF INDIA, Rishikesh - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Absolutely amazing experience! I didn’t know food could taste this good! Amazing service as well! Such a gem!

Name: VARR - TEMPLE FOOD OF INDIA, Rishikesh - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: A Restaurant Meal Meant to be in Bucket of 100 Things to Do Before I Die
Detail Review:
Varr- The Temple Restaurant is a hidden gem in the precints Rishikesh. It is a captive property of HolyWater by Ganga Kinare' hotel, but dining is with reservations and walk-in for both inhouse guests and external visitors.

It its located 200 metres from its sibling...propery ' Gange Kinare Boutique hotel' on Veerbhadra Road, Rishikesh.

Concept:
The theme and concept of Varr (read as 'Var' in Hindi for Vardan' is unique and fascinating with its Artisinal Thalis aggregated around various temples, religious institutions and deities.
Entire interiors are done in mild mustard and saffron colours with all servings on Bell Metal utensils.

I applaud the vision of Chef Anuj Kapoor and the team of Sandeep Bhatt, leading the hopitality.

Food:
- Menu is consolidated into 'Temple Bhog Thalis' - Utsav, Rachna, Naivedayam & Anandam
- Each Thali is rotated by a day
- Food items are  famed prasadams or linked to popular worship institutions and deities
- Each Meal is initiated by Achchaman (Purity ritual) and Charna-Amrit is given to all guests.
- Subsequently, udhyapan puja is done with Mantra and Chants by Mr. Sandeep Bhatt, Restaurant Manager
- Dhuan Chaas and Sheetal Samagri (a mildly sweet and fragrant drinking water)
stole my heart.

A special mention is of the Team -
Mr. Sandeep Bhatt, the Restaurant Manager and his team go out of the way to make it an extremely amazing experience.

He patiently explains each item on the menu and lovingly exhorts the guests to take more servings, similar to a meal at home. 
With a lineage from a Brahmin Acharya Famly, his knowledge of mantra,scriptures and foundation of each item on menu, compliments the experience. He furthers it by conducting Udhyapan Puja before a meal.

Having travelled widely across India and abroad, I haven't seen anything like Varr. One visit is not enough and I left wanting more. 
Residing 300 kilometres from Rishikesh, I'm actually planning to driven down 1 weekend to taste other Bhog Thalis.

Probably would request Founder Owner Mr. Gulati, to consider expanding Varr- Temple Food of India, to other regions too.More

Name: ABU RESTAURANT, Mount Abu - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Out of all the restaurants I went to in Mount Abu, Shree Abu was the worst. 

The food arrived swimming in oil and the ingredients were not fresh. The coriander sprinkled on top of my Dum Aloo was partly brown it was so old, and...the salad was limp and tasteless. This could be because the ingredients stand in the open right next to the road all day. The taste of the Dum Aloo was so bad that I only had one small bite before deciding I was going to leave and find another restaurant. 

I sent all the food back and I told the waiter why I was returning it. I said I was not going to eat the food but that I would pay for it and asked for the bill. The waiter called the manager and I was stopped from leaving the restaurant because they were insisting that I order something else. This was embarrassing. 

Eventually, I managed to get the bill from the cashier, who was making a point of trying to embarrass me further. He made an even bigger point of taking my money. It was very awkward.   

The quality of the food is poor, the ingredients are not fresh, the restaurant has no vibe or atmosphere and there were mosquitoes everywhere, the staff were just plain nasty - I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.More

Name: KAVERI RESTAURANT, Ranchi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review:
Yummy yummy yum it is seriously the most refined indian cuisine restaurant in town. I am a real devout to this place since I don’t remember when; though I am very late writing this review here. The multilayered orchestra of flavours that devote more to...the artistry of cooking than the mere use of correct masalas and heat. They don’t just serve food here but they serve an age old legacy, tradition and discipline (the awesomeness in the taste gets better every-time you discover something new on their menu), I recently tried vegetable Singapuri which was a true delight, mushroom Saag was another great ensemble to my luncheon. It is every foodies Dream Déjeuner Palace. If you want to commit to an elaborate lunch or dinner don’t forget to try the famous Veg Thali here. Even the veg pizza here is great too, if you don’t want a ton on your plate its is a satiety meal in its own. On my last visit I asked to meet the owner to thank him for the great food, and he was so humble to come our table in the end to meet us; a very humble and beautiful soul Mr. Bhatia (He also gave us a generous discount on our bill). 
The overall experience here is mouthwatering, a true palatal delight that will make your tastebuds go dancing… 
Bottom line:
Staff - Well behaved,Courteous
Menu - Diverse and justifiable 
Ambience - Very earthy and refreshing 
Food - supercalifragilisticexpialidocious
(I hope the I spelled it correctly).
Overall A Five Star 
Ranchi’s own Michelin Star RestaurantMore

I just wanted to thank you for the wonderful food & the excellent service you provided for our niece's wedding @ Celebration Banquet on 7th April 2021. We received only positive comments about the quality & quantity of the food. Everything was amazing-full of flavor...and as promised more than enough for everyone and we could not have asked for anything better.  You were professional, clean, and did an amazing job.  Your wonderful Customer Service and Delicious Food made our event special. The food got rave reviews, the service and display were lovely, and everyone went home happy.
We were very happy to give a recommendation to everyone who asked us about the caterer. You were so easy to work with within the planning stages and were willing to give suggestions. We appreciated this very much. You were instrumental in making it a day to remember for our family.  
Best wishes & continued success in the future.
Best Regards
Jawed KhanMore

Detail Review: A group of nearly 20 celebrated my daughter's birthday here. We were in one of two tables occupied on friday afternoon. Very nice ambiance. Was not offered any alcoholic beverages so dont know if they have a license. The buffet is served on ur plates...and I found it very very slow. All dishes are served in a sequence so if u want appetizers, u need to wait for serving of soup to be completed. Food was alright and staff was friendly.More

Name: LEE'S CHINESE RESTURANT, Hyderabad - Jubilee Hills/Banjara Hills - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Do you crave for authentic Chinese cuisine around the city?

If yes, then go no far. Lees is the answer to it.Chinese cuisine has been distorted regarding its flavors. Today’s so-called Chinese can be referred as Indochinese which adequately sums up the fact that, there...are very few places which serves you with authentic Chinese cuisine.More

Name: LEE'S CHINESE RESTURANT, Hyderabad - Jubilee Hills/Banjara Hills - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Great Chinese restaurant with a view
Detail Review:
Excellent chinese cuisine. We really enjoyed this restaurant and have so far visited twice this week and we expect to return:-) The food is excellent with interesting new flavours. We were not familiar with the Hakka cuisine and really liked it. Fresh ingredients and great...texture, which is something I have at times found to be missing in other Chinese restaurants.
And the place is extremely clean and neat and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. Really out of the ordinary. We came late afternoon with our one year old son and they were very helpful. The owner, Andrew is third generation Chinese in India and we had an interesting conversation with him and his lovely daughter Hannah. The place has a great feel to it and we enjoyed the look of kids sporting their kites on the Hyderabad sky.More

Name: LEE'S CHINESE RESTURANT, Hyderabad - Jubilee Hills/Banjara Hills - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
I had a great time at lunch at Lee's. The owner with his baby daughter, Hannah, is a great conversationalist, very knowledgeable and makes great food recommendations! He's a third generation Chinese-Indian; his ancestry moved to Calcutta from China and his parents moved south to...Hyderabad from Calcutta. Enough about him, let's talk about the business. The restaurant is situated on the 4th floor and is accessible by elevator. This is a restaurant with a view! Not many I've come across in Hyderabad. My husband and I were gonna go shop at Anushree Reddy, across the street, and decided to stop for lunch here. We are both huge foodies and love Chinese, so this stop was perfect for us. 
It was a vegetarian kind of day for us: 
-Hakka Bamboo Rice (served in real bamboo trunks) 
-Diamond Vegetables 
-Veg Fried Wantons
-Lee's version of manchurian 
All of the dishes were so so delicious. The sauces were equally noteworthy. 
The best thing that I liked about this experience, aside from the food, was story behind this restaurant. It's the story of a man who has travelled around the world but came back to Hyderabad to serve his people delicious, organic and authentic Indo-Chinese food.More

Name: THE ONE, New Delhi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Halal, Gluten Free Options
Quote: Nice ambience with decent (not amazing, not bad) food. The best staff ever.
Detail Review:
This is the main restaurant of Hotel Le Meridian. 

PROS: 
1) The ambience, Vibe and crowd is good.
2) The buffet spread is decent in terms of variety and cuisines. Lunch has more variety (in my view) compared to Dinner
3) The food tastes good...(Not amazing, not bad) 
4) The entire Staff is courteous and provide a great service. They listen to you and quickly help you in case of any special food requirements. Special mention to the manager Rahul Ahluwalia who made sure me and my family had everything what we needed. One of the best staff i have ever seen. 

CONS:

1) Almost everything (all snacks, main course and curries) was at room temperature and not Hot. They put food in hot plates and not on top of an electric stove or burners. However on asking to get hot food, Rahul and his colleagues quickly provided us with hot dishes what we asked. I was told that the restaurant is looking into this (apparently other guests also do complain about food not being hot) and this will be solved in next couple of months

Overall a good experienceMore

Name: RAIL COACH RESTURANT BHOPAL - Restaurant Reviews & Photos - Tripadvisor
Quote: World's 1st Rail Coach Restaurant BHOPAL EXPRESS
Detail Review:
We stayed in MPT Lakeview residency & came to know about restaurant. In North India we have many restaurants in aeroplanes but finding a restaurant in broad gauge rail coach was a thrilling experience. Had our tasty dinner there. A full atmosphere of plateform, coach...on track was made. Ambiance was very pleasing. Windows have TV screens showing pictures as if train is running,     sound of running train, sound of Chai selling was charming. cutlery was good. Food tasty although fancy names for routine dishes. Staff well behaved & courteous. Rates were very reasonable as compared to North Indian restaurants

Overall a unique & good experiance.More

Name: GOLDEN DRAGON - TAJ MAHAL PALACE, MUMBAI - South Mumbai - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
This renovated restaurant carries legacy from the olden days for its authentic chinese cuisine and a sad note of the carnage carried out by terrorist.
The restaurant had a packed seating fully due to festival of Parsis. Fortunately the booking reservation was done well in...advance.
Most of the staff seem been working from a long time and have carried the Taj legacy. Top managers are changing. Both have seen to it that the service are well attended as most clientele have a great expectation.
The chef who form a backbone need to be commended for their excellent dining out various dishes to the taste of the visitors.
Our experience has been good. Fully veg and well served. A slight glitch but was taken care well. 
Only regret was some foreigner who dine out have a particularly loud noise when rthey speak on their cell phones regardless of the surrounding and whether their stiff upper voice is disturbing others.
There is no particular dish that I would recommend as whatever we ordered was upto markMore

Name: GOLDEN DRAGON - TAJ MAHAL PALACE, MUMBAI - South Mumbai - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We went to Golden Dragon for dinner on a Friday evening at 8pm. Reservations are required because it fills up quickly. The food and service were excellent, and absolutely worth the price. We ordered the stir fried prawns with ginger, scallion and chilli, the lemon...coriander soup with chicken, the lobster butter chilli oyster, the sautéed scallops, ginger, garlic and broccoli, the burnt garlic stir fried rice with seafood, and the dark chocolate toffee with honey nut crunch ice cream.

Everything was nice, but the scallops and lobster dishes were exceptional. The scallops were perfectly cooked, and the sauce that the lobster came with is one of the best I've ever had. The prawns were also delicious.

The service was quick, and the waiters were very helpful and made good recommendations. I will definitely visit again.More

Name: GOLDEN DRAGON - TAJ MAHAL PALACE, MUMBAI - South Mumbai - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: GOLDEN DRAGON - TAJ MAHAL PALACE, MUMBAI - South Mumbai - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
This renovated restaurant carries legacy from the olden days for its authentic chinese cuisine and a sad note of the carnage carried out by terrorist.
The restaurant had a packed seating fully due to festival of Parsis. Fortunately the booking reservation was done well in...advance.
Most of the staff seem been working from a long time and have carried the Taj legacy. Top managers are changing. Both have seen to it that the service are well attended as most clientele have a great expectation.
The chef who form a backbone need to be commended for their excellent dining out various dishes to the taste of the visitors.
Our experience has been good. Fully veg and well served. A slight glitch but was taken care well. 
Only regret was some foreigner who dine out have a particularly loud noise when rthey speak on their cell phones regardless of the surrounding and whether their stiff upper voice is disturbing others.
There is no particular dish that I would recommend as whatever we ordered was upto markMore

Name: GOLDEN DRAGON - TAJ MAHAL PALACE, MUMBAI - South Mumbai - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

After long time had superb food at golden Dragon. i have been visiting for last 25 years back to its old glory. the resturant is inside the iconic taj mahal hotel. Tariq got us the...table despite the resturant being full. Rakesh was outstanding and helped us in selecting dimsum and fried rice with vegetables. suresh also was very helpful. Corn soup was perfect after many years. fried rice with vegetables was out of the world. taj is back to its old glory thanks to superb Ceo Punit Chatwal. After many years seeing this.More

Name: HAVELI, Jalandhar - Grand Trunk Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
I visited this place on 24/03/2023 on a rainy day with family and friends specially to have dinner and long drive from ludhiana.
It was a warm welcome as there were boys with huge umbrellas to guide you towards the restaurant to avoid rain showers...on you.
There are few stalls installed outside the restaurant of quick bites .
To my surprise I was informed that outside food from stalls shall only be served inside if we order main course ( dinner ) with them although stalls are also run by the owner of the restaurant. I did tell them that I shall order dinner only after having snacks from outside but I was told to go out and help my self with self service and they would only serve me if I place order for dinner with them .. Disgusting
Although I had dinner there only because I was accompanied by my family and friends
But I was completely unethical and DisgustingMore

Name: HOTEL PARAGON RESTAURANT, Kozhikode - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Halal, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: No more words than just yummy.. Biriyani is my favorite here specially chicken.. Appam and fish curry made with coconut milk is just another favorite combo..

Name: HOTEL PARAGON RESTAURANT, Kozhikode - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Halal, Gluten Free Options
Quote: Timeless Charm, Excellent Service, Amazing Food, Unbeatable Prices!
Detail Review:
One of the oldest restaurants in town, I was instantly transported back in time with its charming old interiors.

The service was simply outstanding, as the staff was attentive and courteous in spite of the heavy rush, there were at least a 50 people waiting...outside to get in. And everyone got a smile from the staffs.

Now, let's talk about the food. The food was beyond amazing! Prepared with authentic flavors, the biriyani was so good that my kids just loved it.
The most delightful surprises, they had Vegetable biriyani and i didnt leave a tiny grain of rice behind. Every bite was a pure delight.

What impressed me the most was the unbelievable affordability. Despite its longstanding reputation and excellent service, the prices were incredibly cheap.

It's a place where time slows down, and you can savor both history and culinary artistry.

I can't recommend it highly enough, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit!More

Name: HOTEL PARAGON RESTAURANT, Kozhikode - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Halal, Gluten Free Options
Quote: Great place for non-veg Kerala food in Kozhikode, a place not to be missed.
Detail Review:
Been here for breakfast and late lunch on our way to Wayanad from Kozhikode and back. 

Breakfast was extraordinary. We ordered Appam, Idiappam, Chicken curry, Veggie stew, Parotta and a Pazham Pori. Except Idiappam, everything tasted great. Idiappam was a little soggy. We thoroughly enjoyed...the breakfast. 

Two days later, we were at the same place for lunch, somewhat late in the afternoon like 4:30PM. We ordered Nei Choru, Parottas, Fish Fry, Chicken curry and Fish Curry. All tasted good, particularly the fish fry was quite unique and tasted extremely good. It was like I never had it anywhere else, except one Malayali restaurant in Chennai called Kumarakom which is not that famous anymore. 

The building and ambiance looks old, but kept neat and clean. Surprisingly the breakfast was pretty cheap, like Rs. 400 for 3 people. The lunch was quite expensive, due to the fish dishes we ordered, still its worth the money. 

I would strongly recommend this place for anyone landing in Kozhikode for anytime, breakfast, lunch or dinner. This is both cost effective and tasty. I will never miss it whenever I visit Kozhikode.More

Name: HOTEL PARAGON RESTAURANT, Kozhikode - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Detail Review:
Paragon is a Kozhikode institution with an unmatched cuisine with awesome taste

There will be a significant waiting time most of the days specially during the vacation time but...hats off to the staff and the customers who display patience and wait their turn

Detail Review: Our meal at the Paragon restaurant in Calicut was the highlight of a recent trip to Kerala. Chef Thomas's spread was outstanding - from the raw mango drink to the squid, beef Kappa, chicken biriyani, neimeen curry with Kerala parotta, to the elaneer payasam, it...was a meal so sumptuous you could feel the kilos piling on even as your taste buds were overwhelmed. Go if you are in vicinity or even if you are not. And go early as the place is always crowded at lunch and dinner time with long queues waiting patiently to be seated.More

Name: HOTEL PARAGON RESTAURANT, Kozhikode - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Halal, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: At peak lunch time on a Sunday, five of us dropped in at Paragon on our way to Tellicherry. Though it was past 2pm, the restaurant was brimming with guests - many waiting for their turn at the tables. We were lucky to find a...table for five and from there on, it was a trip to food heaven! We ordered neichoru, fish with mango curry, prawn roast, mutton biriyani - and each item was to die for. All the meat and seafood was fresh. How the restaurant manages to retain the right taste, especially with consistency given the volumes that have to cater for, is amazing. The service was top class and very proactive. Paragon is a restaurant that I can go to, again and again. The food does not fail, ever. The taste is worth the effort.More

Name: MANGALAM INDIAN RESTURANT, Bundi - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Although this little old guest house is tucked away in the oldest part of Bundi it has the most delightful family in it to welcome and look after you.  I was staying for two nights and the dinners and breakfasts were absolutely delicious, and the...extremely low prices for the bedrooms is probably commensurate with what you receive.  The house is old and situated round a central court with all the rooms facing the center.  The restaurant used to be on the roof until the monkeys started stealing the food so you eat now next to the kitchen! Even if you are not on a budget stay I would still recommend you to go and enjoy the wonderful cooking.  My best wishes and thanks to you allMore

Name: SHIVERS GARDEN RESTAURANT, Candolim - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: SHIVERS GARDEN RESTAURANT, Candolim - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We have visited this restaurant many times over the years but this visit was the best ever. They have changed the menu and gone more pan Asian - with many superb Thai dishes and also Japanese sushi. They still have the Indian and Chinese on...the menu. The food was excellent and the service matched with even the chef coming out to serve us. The Pannacotta desert was lovely. Truly amazing - they deserve to be busier. Certainly the best meal we have had since we arrived 2 weeks ago.More

Name: SHIVERS GARDEN RESTAURANT, Candolim - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
After discovering Shivers last year we knew we’d return. It didn’t disappoint.
We were in Candolim for 6 days and ate at Shivers 3 times. The food and service were both excellent.
Amongst our favourites were the dim sum, fish wrapped in banana leaves, the...lobster and mud crab. All absolutely to die for. 
An absolute must go to place if your in the area.More

Name: SHIVERS GARDEN RESTAURANT, Candolim - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Beautiful hidden gem. For long had it in the bucket list, finally today ticked it. Ambience is just awesome, cool vibes. Our steward Deepak was fantastic. We ordered The Cottage Cheese Bao, Deep Fried Water chestnut,  Naga Chicken sukka, Pan fried gyoza, Special Pink Sushi,...Ramen,  Pad Thai and Chocolate Gooey cake. All the dishes were exceptional. The Pad Thai was slightly sweeter but the feedback was well taken by the stewards. The Ramen broth was rich and very flavourful. Even the Veg sushi was tasty. The naga chicken was spicy but the spice was such that you have to take another bite because of how good it was.  The best part of this whole meal was the appetizers we got from the restaurant. It was a Grape Leaf with assortments that was a nice experience to eatt. We also enjoyed the kokum testubes.More

Name: SHIVERS GARDEN RESTAURANT, Candolim - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: This is a lovely pan Asian restaurant in Candolim Goa. The ambience was very relaxing. The staff were very friendly and the service was excellent. We had Penang style flat noodles, laksa chilli chicken, Vietnamese spring rolls, naga style pork curry with bamboo shoots amongst...other things. A must try if you are in that area.More

Name: SHIVERS GARDEN RESTAURANT, Candolim - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: ZAFFRON RESTURANT CHENNAI PALIKARANAI, Chennai (Madras) - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Name: ZAFFRON RESTURANT CHENNAI PALIKARANAI, Chennai (Madras) - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Stop here for Barbeque and Grills
Detail Review:
If you are witnessing a plethora of small Restaurants that are mushrooming around every streets of Chennai, whose minimum requirement is to have an Air conditioner rooms, Tandoori/grill oven, almost a similar menu with a list of North Indian and Chinese foods (most of them...won’t be available across every restaurant all the time) and servant maids from North East, then probably you are going to read one of the similar review from an frequent passerby on this road.

Let me keep it short and sweet.

Zaffron – Palikaranai, few meteres away from CTS office 

What to expect: Grills, tandoori and Barbeque, breads. 

What;s different here: Peeper Barbeques (little unique in taste and must try)

Bills: nominal (500 for 2) 

Hints: prefer the 1st floor for dinning.More

Name: DROPADI, Palolem - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Visited based on TripAdvisor rating for Palolem and number of reviews (over 1,000 at time of visiting).
Food was truly great, went twice out of 5 meals.
Crab Masala, one of the specials, is now one of my top 5 Indian dishes for sure.
Service...was great, staff offered shot glasses of the different wines for us to choose.
VISA accepted without issues.
Decor is practical - the full front sea view sells itself!More

Name: DROPADI, Palolem - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: North Indian food fix in Palolem
Detail Review: It is extremely unusual to find a new daal recipe in Goa. And that too in Palolem.  Dropadi surprised us with something called daal balti (rajmah, chhole, sabut urad and chana daal in a tomatoey sweet sour base, with ajwain in the tadka). It is...just off the official entrance to Palolem beach and is well worth the effort if u need a fix of North Indian food. The chicken tikka was also very competent. We had been told the continental food was also very good but the bannofee pie did not meet the standard.More

Name: DROPADI, Palolem - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: The waiter is too arrogant .. doesn’t talk properly. If any questions asked they treat people as if we are poor . We are paying so we have all rights to ask what’s his bloody problem .

Name: DROPADI, Palolem - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We ate here a couple of times, once for lunch we had a tandoori whole chicken, which was excellent. 
The cocktails were also great. 
However we enquired about a seafood platter for the evening and we’re quoted 9,000 rup for 4 people. The waiter was...quite pushy and wanted us to commit, which we didn’t, as this price is more than double that of other places along the beach. 
It’s a real shame as it’s a nice place and the food coming out of the tandoor is amazing. 
But our experience was marred by the waiter trying to up-sell the fish, so we never returned.More

Name: DROPADI, Palolem - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Detail Review: We visited here three times during our week in Palolem. We loved the sea food curries and enjoyed  dishes like Prawn Sukha and Kingfish Tikka. Quality fresh fish and cooked well (unlike some other ‘fish curries’ we came across). The restaurant was quieter early evening...so east to get a sea facing table. When busy, was popular with Indians, which was a good sign. Would recommend. And they take cards, which was handy (Nireas and Zest in Palolem also take cards).More

Name: LA UPPU, Mysuru (Mysore) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Service of the Staff is a big Issue. Leaving a Few.
Detail Review:
I am writing this review as I was not only staying in Grand Mercure but used 'La Uppu' for my Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner. 
During my first day of stay had lunch which was amazing esp. the Methi Murg, Vast Selection of Veg/Non-Veg, Desserts etc....In the Dinner we found that most of the items were repeated as to what was served in lunch.
Where it setbacks is during the breakfast as during our 3-day stay there was no change in the buffet menu not even one single item whatsoever. 

The biggest drawback of restaurant:
1. One and only staff while this problem goest with most of the Accor hotels I have stayed in. Didn't expect the same in Grand Mercure.

2. Totally reluctant staff they will avoid looking at you so they don't need to handle any guest request. For Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner we had to literally wait sometimes for 15min+ so one of the staff can listen to the request.

3. At Breakfast when checked with one of the staff they only had omlets, Dosa at live station. But when Tapas came to help us he gave us the whole range like bacon, Sausages etc. (So Accor need to look into this issue why this happened that one staff is totally reluctant even to spit out whole menu that is available while other tells a different story).

3. Sanjay the manager was good enough to come and listen to our feedback on our last day. 

4. The whole restaurant credit even for 2 stars go to Tapas (Super-Energetic, Always Helpful, Quick - Service, If he wouldn't have told us about more food options available at live coking during breakfast we would have never come to know what all is really available).

5. Restaurant should have gems like Tapas who make guest feel they are sitting in a 5-star restaurant which easily can go otherwise looking at other staff behavior.More

Recommended is the rava fried mackeral & stuffed rechado pomfret, served with a generous salad & fries.

Name: MACHAN RESTAURANT, Nainital - The Mall Rd - Restaurant Reviews & Photos - Tripadvisor

Detail Review: We ordered veg wonton soup which was good. I was holding an apple and waiter offered to cut it and even sprinkled chaat masala over it. Name: MACHAN RESTAURANT, Nainital - The Mall Rd - Restaurant Reviews & Photos - Tripadvisor
Quote: Be sure to choose your dishes carefully to avoid any surprises.
Detail Review:
During my recent trip to Nainital, I was on the hunt for some great food and was recommended to try Machan Restaurant for dinner. I decided to give it a go and ordered a takeaway of fish curry and chapati. While the chapati was well...cooked and tasted delicious, the fish curry left a lot to be desired. It was unexpectedly sweet and almost tasted like butter chicken instead of a traditional fish curry.

Although my experience at Machan Restaurant was average, I can't deny that the service was satisfactory and the packaging of my takeaway order was neat and tidy. If you're in Nainital and looking to dine out, Machan Restaurant is definitely worth a try, but be sure to choose your dishes carefully to avoid any surprises.More

Name: MACHAN RESTAURANT, Nainital - The Mall Rd - Restaurant Reviews & Photos - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Very good food. We tried North indian and spring rolls. Panner and dal. Makhani was delicious. The view is also cool. You can have the view of the lake. The staff is also very responsive

Name: MACHAN RESTAURANT, Nainital - The Mall Rd - Restaurant Reviews & Photos - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: A packed place and know for its foods quality. the food is never disappointing and any item you pick-up from menu is worth-it.

Name: MACHAN RESTAURANT, Nainital - The Mall Rd - Restaurant Reviews & Photos - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: The ambience is great and so is the food. The staff is courteous. The decor is pleasing, especially in the evenings with dim lighting. A pleasant view of the Nainital Lake during the day time.

Name: MACHAN RESTAURANT, Nainital - The Mall Rd - Restaurant Reviews & Photos - Tripadvisor
Quote: A must place for fine dining
Detail Review:
Wat a fabulous place . I sat here after 15 yrs n still it has kept it's taste n service intact .
More than d food , wat attracted me was d service by Mr Arjun who politely took orders , got my items delivered...n even packed sone potion left. 

Set with scenic lake by its side , i was greeted with neat n cosy interiors , some 8 tables n tidy tables n cutlery.

Ordered d awesome "kheera raita" n mind u , it ain't anything one prepares at home by cutting kheera . Infact , kheera was mildly fried with jeera n few spices n mixed to give it such a different taste . Lovely .

Next up , d softest rotis ever . Ones that can be easily broken with a finger .
Also ordered mix veg , a great preparation . 

Not to forget , i didn't have to ask waiter to get , onion/green chutney / pickle . All provided at d start only .

M so very happy.  Looking forward to try ur other fares sometime in futureMore

Name: ALAV, Indore - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
It was a good  experience and a nice tryout choosing this spot over others as we got bored eating in the restaurants for years. And when alav opened up, we were, why not try this place as the queue for waiting was also too long...on that day.
So for moderately pricing restaurants choose alav over othersMore

Name: ALAV, Indore - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Ambience was really good. The food was delicious and the service was good too!
The quantity of the dishes was enough, I really enjoyed the food here.

Name: ALAV, Indore - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Have been to this restaurant many times and usually experience was good. But I have always felt that in this industry, mistakes are bound to happen and what is needed is to accept and amend them.

We ordered "today's special". Somehow I always felt that...this word in itself is a big scam. Restaurants prepare it in bulk and instruct staff to get it in most of the orders.

What we were served was not even warm, not to mention it did taste awful. And when we brought it to the notice of their staff, they were not ready to accept. They did a lot of time pass and our breads were getting cold in the wait of their reply.  Finally I called them again and asked to get me another dish, they may charge for their today's special also, but throw it in dustbin.

They replaced dish finally but we had to finish our meal with cold and chewy breads.

It was a bad experience.More

Name: ALAV, Indore - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: It's a fine dining restaurant with reasonable price. The restaurant has variety of food in offering and the taste is truly good.  Ambience of the restaurant is also good and it is quite favourite among families. Usually there is a waiting time during the evenings...on weekends.  I recommend their Kabab Platter which is top class.More

Name: ALAV, Indore - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: One of the best place I have ever eaten at,worth going,nice ambience,worth taking your family to,the mocktails are good too.

Detail Review: We visited them when the place had a problem with its exhaust system, so we were seated in an annexe.  We had Chinese food, which was tasty.  The service was a bit slow due to the dislocation probably.  We definitely recommend the place.

Name: ALAV, Indore - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Alav is a very new restaurant conveniently located in the central and popular Palasia locality of the city. Indore is popular for its food and there is no shortage of good restaurants offering great food. However, Alav does stand out from the crowd with lip...smacking north indian cuisine served hot and fresh by their friendly and pleasing staff. I recently visited the place for the first time and I am pretty sure I am going to be a regular there. 
Special mention for their Paneer Malai tikka. Melt in the mouth paneer cubes bunched with veggies and cheddar cheese grilled in the oven to perfection. 
Do try that.More

Name: ALAV, Indore - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Name: SANJHA CHULHA, New Delhi - 17/A-31 Market - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Poor Service Restaurant with Good Food.
Detail Review:
This is a family fine dine in restaurant,having good service sometimes back,but now the food quality is good but service becomes very poor.They will take too much time to deliver your order on table even if you are the only one in restaurant.
Cost wise...its average not much expensive.the only negative factor is the Service,else everything is good.More

Name: SANJHA CHULHA, New Delhi - 17/A-31 Market - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
If your looking for delicious and tasty food around Kailash Colony area, this is the place to be. Nice fin-dining restaurant, a place to visit with your friends and family. 

The place has good ambiance and nice serving staff. Most importantly, pricing is also quite...normal. Not at all heavy on the pocket.

The food here is pretty amazing. Especially Non-veg dishes. Personal favorite include Butter chicken, Chicken tikka and Afghani Chicken. Even veg-dishes are pretty cool too.  You can try Dal makhani and Paneer Butter masala. 

Also, good thing about this place is it is open till 1am. You can sit in the restaurant as well as order food in your car just outside. Cars are always lined up outside the restaurant, mostly at night.

To sum it up, if you want to treat your taste buds, go and visit Sanjha Chulha.

One suggestion - You guys can play a little soft music as well which will greatly enhance the dining experience. Rest, everything is amazing. Keep up the good work guys.More

Name: SANJHA CHULHA, New Delhi - 17/A-31 Market - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Where do i start from. Place is anytime good for snacks to a full meal, be it vegetarian / non - vegetarian. Panner tikka is very sumptuous, butter chicken again a mouth watering dish. In breads, stuffed paranthas, missi roti, tandoori roti all make it...a good place to eat. It is better to call for home delivery than dining at the place. Coz it is more like a take away joint!More

Name: SANJHA CHULHA, New Delhi - 17/A-31 Market - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
