(However, it might be a good idea to avoid non-Indian (Chinese or Thai) if you know how...they really taste).More

Name: CURRY CHATTY, Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Authentic Kerala Seafood cuisine - A MUST visit!
Detail Review:
Ambience - Brilliant! A real Kerala feel. An old Kerala traditional house converted into a restaurant. They have retained the nallukettu within with well maintained mud-glazed walls with local art. 

Clean and well appointed too. 

Food Taste - The Kerala Seafood cuisine was absolutely fabulous!...Fresh, chunky , tasty prawns, mussels cooked and presented very well. 

A MUST visit for some authentic FRESH seafood Kerala experience! 

NOTE for the Management: 

1. Music - You have taken all the trouble to deliver an authentic Kerala Experience. Why would you have different kinds of  loud music from hip-hop, trance, dubsteps in an authentic Kerala experience??!! Please change the music to a lovely Kerala ethnic Lounge music and ensure that the team are fully trained on the sound and the kind of music to be played. 

2. Your Kerala offerings are SO incredibly good. Just do not know why you are then offering all sorts of cuisines of this world starting from Thai, Chinese, North Indian etc. Etc.??! Today, it is about being a speciality restaurant of some specific cuisine. Since you are SO good in the local cuisine, why on earth would you try to become a Jack of all cuisine?? 

All customers when we were dining were ordering only Kerala cuisine too. 

Please market and get your identity/space based on your Kerala cuisine expertise and in case, someone insists or wants only other food , offer them a set menu option of other cuisine. Even your marketing communications talk about different other cuisine other than authentic Kerala cuisine . The slogan/tagline should just be - "Authentic Kerala!"

Being in the hotel industry, my sincere advise would be for you to refocus back on your expertise and market that specifically all over. 

3. Menu Cards : Please update and process NEW menu cards / booklet. They seem to have NOT been replaced from the start of the restaurant. SO, unhygienic! 

To conclude, salute to the ownership for a fantastic concept, service and delivery of the cuisine!More

Name: CURRY CHATTY, Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Had a bowl of manchow soup and a squid fry. The manchow is a simple indian chinese soup hot and rich on flavour - this one was very salty with semicooked nudles on the top... Not crisp but chewy... Naaah! Cant really see the finesse...that you might expect from a restaurant attempting on delivering fine dining. The squid fry is more like a starter with some sad (small and thin sliced) pieces of squid. There is nothing fine in the squid fry other than the squid. The red onion and  limeleafs are totally killing the taste of of the puny squid and the heavy texture of the coconut is taking away the sensation of the slender squid. The chilis are strong in both dishes but that is ok - its the flavours that are unbalanced/unrefined leaning towards pungent in both dishes. Might be your thing? They have a wide menu so go find out. My self I dont trust the chefs palate so I am done. 

The service is agile and very helpful. Prices are over average.More

Name: CURRY CHATTY, Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Great delicacies and authentic theme dining restaurant.. Great hospitality and the best part is they cook u exactly how u need defining the word meaning theme dinner

Name: CURRY CHATTY, Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Name: CURRY CHATTY, Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
The restaurants professes to serve three different types of food - there starts our story of a disappointing meal. Many of the appetizers we asked, they came back,  and told us that they didn’t have. 

We were accidentally given two different menus. It seemed to...be really N Indian and Kerala menus. The restaurant has severs from the NE of india and also has a Chinese motif and then menus with food from india. About half of the food was good and about half was quite bad.

The Kurma was sweet and did not taste like anything I had eaten. The meen curry was watery and not a good curry at all. The curry did not seem to have set. I enjoyed the hot and sour soup. It had whole pepper corns etc. and very tasty. what I enjoyed the most in my meal. The table also liked the nye chooor or ghee rice. The Netoli or sardine fry was tasty. We ordered two chicken dishes, the chicken Uli or onion spread was good. The chicken curry (Kozhi Mappas) was so so. 

The staff needs more training and several staff waiting in clumps unsure of their role. The first plates and silverware were removed. New plates without new silver wear were returned. 

Overall a below average dining experience.More

Name: CURRY CHATTY, Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Its a dish made of Fish boiled in Steam while covered with masala inside a Banana leaf. The aroma was so pulling and the taste...was flavorful. Its a unique dish of Kerala. I am from Tamilnadu. Nevertheless, I love any cuisine which have good taste. Love this dish. Anyone going to Kerala, please try this dish. Its located near to Trivandrum Railway Station.  "The taste of Fish is awesome" !!!!!!More

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Good with potential to be better
Detail Review:
Had lunch here today. Starters included Chili Pork, Chicken Lollipop and Fooyong. The Fooyong was forgettable as was the Lollipop. Pork was decent.

Main courses included Meifoon Rice Noodles (good) and Lemon Chicken (acceptable).

All said, not a bad place to dine, but only if...you have no other options.More

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Mostly local young crowd visit this place considering alcohol being quite reasonably priced. Super lousy, terrible ambience, horrible service and below par food quality. Only good for a quick couple of standard drinks.

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Located in Tangra famous for many other Chinese eateries, this one is not to be missed.
1) The compound just adjacent to it is used for parking with valet services 
2) Be sure to be early as the waiting can get lengthy 
3) They have...one of the best waiting systems. If seats are full, patrons are requested to wait in the terrace with ample space. When asked to wait, a coupon with number is given which is the called to as and when the time comes. Very professionally arranged
4) Most of the captains are well informed and will advice you perfectly in ordering.
5) Don’t forget the pudding( caramel custard) : it’s overlooked but a must tryMore

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Pork served and cooked in the same utensil with other dishes
Detail Review: It was one of my fav places in kolkata when I talk about chinese, however  recently they included Pork to their menu and the worst you expected was the same utensil being used for other dishes. A well settled , high demand and trusted restaurant...shouldng have done this as we have regular customers from different sects of the society like vegans and halal seekers. Should avoid if you have trouble with pork no matter how many times the stewards tell you that they have a separate utensil. I sneaked in my self to verify this.More

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:

   Our friends ordered a chicken soup, fried chicken, noodles and fried rice. It was good, although I would have preferred authentic Chinese food.

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We tried pepper chicken, golden fried prawn, thread paneer, chinese chicken chopsuey, egg fried rice and chicken hot garlic. Food was awesome. The green chilli chutney was simply too good to go with the starters. Ambience was good. We had been there early on a...Sunday. By the time we finished, the place was packed. Will visit again when in KolkataMore

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Things start shaky. Seafood Soup (Rs 120) that I decide to start with and various other soups that my team order all turn out to be glorified dish water. Thread Chicken (Rs 350) that my server enthusiastically recommends calling it all-time best seller also turns...out to be a bit of a dud, with fried vermicelli clinging on to tasteless morsels of chicken. But soon things perk up.

Bhetki Fish Fry (Rs 550) has flaky fish encased in a halfhearted batter but it is the quality of the fish that carries the dish through. Shrimp Cake (Rs 450) is more of a jhinga cutlass (as one would call it in Mumbai) and is piping hot and delicious. The star of the meal is steamed Fish Fillet with chilly, pepper, garlic (Rs 800) which is fish at its best. It is a dish that will bring me to this restaurant many times in future too I am sure. Veg Pan Fried noodles (Rs 180) is delicious and comforting too, and Veg Chowmein (Rs 140) simply hits the spot. 

All in all amazing food. Much recommended. But skip the soup…and anything called thread!More

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Well,it's an average Indo Chinese restaurant where consistency of dishes are not stable, some are good and some poor, service is slow and they even served our vegetarian friends with non veg stuff. The price points are attractive, not very expensive. Good for big groups.

They have a very large seating and also have smaller spaces for groups wanting them. Extremely helpful staff and the owner Robert...Liao and his sons are always around. 
For Chinese food, this is my number 1..More

Name: GOLDEN JOY, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: WOK TOK, New Delhi - Vasant Kunj/Vasant Vihar - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Below average food, effectively HORRIBLE ambience, illogically EXCESSIVE pricing BUT Fantastic Service
Detail Review:
We visited this restaurant on Saturday, the 19th of August for dinner.
We were advised to sit at the 'Cascades' because the AC was not working properly at 'Wok Tok'.
However the AC was not working efficiently at Cascades either. There was even a fly...there.
The food left a lot to be desired.

A detailed FOOD review
SOUPS - 2 Manchow chicken, 2 Sweet corn vegetarian & 1 Clear Chicken Soup (1 by two) - Decent 7/10
STARTER - Chicken Chilly Mountain - great taste BUT not hot enough in spite of delayed service. It was room temperature. - Effectively 5/10.
MAIN COURSE:
- Chicken Kung Pao - horrible, drenched in excessive Soya Sauce and full of cashew nuts. It was sweetish bitter and sour - not like the same dish we eat at most places  - 3/10
- Hakka Sliced Lamb - Very good - 8/10
- Silken Tofu with Chilly Bean - Very good 8/10
- Chilly Chicken (outside the menu) - Ordinary but edible - 5.5/10
- 2 Veg Fried Rice - Alright - 6/10
- Veg Hakka Noodles - Above Average - 7/10
DESSERTS:
- 3 Jaggery Ice Creams - Alright - 6/10
- Date Pancake - Alright but with horrid crystallized ice cream - 5/10

PRICING
The pricing was EXCESSIVE - we paid 17,500/- for all of the above + a bottle of water - too much considering that:
1. This restaurant is ALWAYS almost EMPTY – Cascades is also never more than half full AND
2. The Grand is NO Taj, Oberoi or similar brand.
You need to either reduce prices of individual dishes OR increase quantities.
We had to order an extra chicken dish as well as an extra rice dish because of smaller quantities.

SERVICE:
The ONLY redeeming feature of this experience was the service - Your waiters did all they could to cater to us, including to try and fix the AC and even get rid of the fly with a racket. I did not gather the names of the staff members but they were all very nice and cooperative. 

VERDICT
Below average food, effectively HORRIBLE ambience, illogically EXCESSIVE pricing BUT Fantastic ServiceMore

Name: SANGEETHA OKADEY'S, Chennai (Madras) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote:
Okadey Sangeetha Veg resturant a cool 
Ac resturant in RA puram in Chennai.
Detail Review:
To all my foodie friends out there living in Chennai or visiting Chennai India let me tell 
You one thing that's an absolute truth .

You want to enjoy a great authentic  South Indian in Chennai nothing can beat your home food served steaming hot...by your mother tender and loving care with me probably being the next best chef in my family .

Guess what the next best place in my view after eating out in many top restaurants around my City for years ,we have homed on to Okadey Sangeetha Resturant on  ,3rd Cross Rd, Govindaswamy Nagar, Raja Annamalai Puram, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600028 when ever we decide not to cook at home and our Sunday breakfast for years 
Has been at this Okadeys .

Their meal whether it be breakfast lunch snack or a dinner is great served hot and 
Always leaves one with a great after taste. 
That in my view is a great compliment to an eatery. 

Its a Cozy and casual great vegetarian option next best to your home food served with great courtesy by very friendly staff headed by Mr Sridhar Manager ,who spends more time at this  restaurant ,than his home  and is still happily married .He knows most of their usual customers pretty well .

The food served here is very safe for kids and is a  good place for casual group meetings over breakfast especially  for morning fitness freaks with a cover of 120+ 

Although it's a multi cuisine resturant we honestly stick to South Indian breakfast and 
South Indian Thali. Jain food option is available on Sundays. It's open from 8 am to 11 pm on all days 

It also boasts of  a small hall to host a small  party .

All major credit cards are accepted and does have a parking facility for few cars .

Their prices are very reasonable for dining on comfort .

Try out this if you haven't and I am sure you will keep going there again and again.Its the positive energy of this place .!

Address 
No 10/2, 4th Main road, 3rd cross, R.A puram,
Chennai -28
Telephone
044 - 24643898 / 24935879More

Name: SANGEETHA OKADEY'S, Chennai (Madras) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Name: SANGEETHA OKADEY'S, Chennai (Madras) - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Nice hot idli, dosai and vadai - good breakfast option.
Detail Review:
Was there for breakfast recently with a few friends. Compared to the Adayar Sangeetha, it was surprisingly not crowded at 8:45 AM - though it was full by 9:30 but no one was waiting.

Service was prompt and courteous, food was served piping hot and...the staff were ready with the extra sambar when needed.

The usual suspects - idli, vadai, dosai & coffee were ordered. The accompanying sambar and chutney was as expected from Sangeetha both fresh and tasty.

Prices are reasonable and oh - this was the AC section. They have a non-AC section as well.

The vadai was especially good - crispy and not yet not too oily.More

Cusine: Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options, Vegetarian Friendly
Detail Review: Based on TA review, visited the restaurant for dinner. When we visited at around 8.15 pm, the restaurant was almost full. The restaurant has nice Chinese décor and cool ambience, also has adequate sitting space. All staffs were masked. We ordered Crispy Chicken, Sweet Corn...soup, Crispy Chicken, Chowmein, Hot Garlic Chicken and Veg Manchurian.  While veg items were priced at around Rs. 250 range, chicken dishes were priced at around Rs. 350 range. The serving time and serving portion, both were reasonable. The dishes were tasty too. Overall it was a satisfying dining. This is the best Chinese restaurant in the town and a visit is recommended.More

Name: GAMTHI KATHIYWAD RESTURANT, Vadodara - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Ordered kathiawadi food after quite some time. Worried that most kathiawadi serve punjabi also and the resultant taste is not authentic. Pleased to say Gir Gamthi broke this myth as they serve both authentic tastes. Ordered three comboes , sev tameta roti, thepla with suki...bhaji and paneer tikka masala with roti. Portion is more than enough with 4 roti. Paneer is excelent very good gravy.so is sev tameta. And suki bhaji is pleasantly aloo with sing dana as they serve in Udupi restaurant as poori bhaji. One of the best food we ever ate.More

Name: PRIYA RESTAURANT AND BAR, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Popular restaurant for tourist groups - with good location
Detail Review:
The restaurant was overall very disappointing. 
The menus were very worn and falling apart but offered many choices. The food we ordered had generally poor presentation and less than impressive flavor. Among our choices was Russian Salad consisting of potatoes with some apples and bananas...in a whitish sauce. Rice with dry fruits consisted of a bowl of rice with three yellow raisins. Chicken in honey sauce came in a small bowl. My husband’s tandoori chicken with cream sauce came with no sauce but with two haphazard wedges of tomatoes. The flavors of our food were relatively unimpressive.
It appears to be a popular venue frequented by many tourist groups.
We ate lunch there. 
Bathroom without toilet paper. A man followed me there handing a slightly wet dinner napkin for a tip. Thankfully I always carry a toilet paper and disinfectant with me. 
The waiters were polite and kind but made some mistakes.More

Name: PRIYA RESTAURANT AND BAR, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: I come alone and the service was really nice! I asked for not spice and everything was delivered perfectly! I really recommended

Name: PRIYA RESTAURANT AND BAR, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: This restaurant is the worst I've ever been to. The local guides and drivers brings people in because they get a tip and that's the only way this restaurant is surviving probably... The food quantity is very little,not enough even for 1 person, the quality...even bad.and if you do not tip the waiter,they get rude..not going back everMore

Name: PRIYA RESTAURANT AND BAR, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We enjoyed our dinner at Priya restaurant. Food was great (they can adjust every meal in accordance with your own taste e.g. I do not prefer spicy food) and staff was amazing!

Name: PRIYA RESTAURANT AND BAR, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We visited Priya Restaurant and Bar on our way back from Agra tour. We went there with family and ordered Tandoori Chicken, Aloo Paratha, daal makhni, masala papad, masala tea and mutton rogan Josh. We asked for the food to be mild in flavour and...no spice at all. The food was cooked as per our request. Tandoori chicken, masala papad, masala tea and aloo paratha were very delicious. Daal and mutton had less spices as we had asked which somehow made them very bland, nonetheless they were cooked well. What they excelled at was service and hospitality. The person serving us was very polite and made sure we are looked after. I agree with some of the reviews on toilets but I would say that the toilets were clean and at par or better in some parts with the toilet facilities that you see in this area, for example we were provided with toilet tissues and the floor was dry which is hard to get in other toilet in this area unless you are in a five or four star restaurant. So on a relative scale we were even happy with the toilet facilities.More

Name: THE PARK RESTAURANT, Darjeeling - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: The service was quick. I liked the naan but this time I was bit disappointed with the chicken Bharta. I could get the overpowering smell of chicken masala . It was not great . Maybe next time they will do better . Usually I like...their food but there is always a next time .More

Name: THE PARK RESTAURANT, Darjeeling - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Chinise dishes are quite good,  but a bit costly for general people. May try once if pocket permits.

Name: THE PARK RESTAURANT, Darjeeling - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Excellent food and good prices!! I would recommend the street style flat noodles. Quick service and comfortable seating.

Name: THE PARK RESTAURANT, Darjeeling - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
While shopping in Darjeeling, I thought lunch would be just a plate of momos as I had only one day to pick up stuff. I don't know who suggested The Park, but I'm so glad we walked in. Before tasting their awesome food, I was...touched by their warmth when they noticed that my mum was too tired to walk upstairs and offered us a table downstairs. We tried a mix of Thai and Chinese fare. Most were recommended by the staff. All the dishes were gobsmackingly good. We were all meeting after a very long time and The Park's top-notch service made the day even more memorable. After lunch, they generously kept my mum company while the rest of us shopped some more. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for the lovely time. To the helpful and friendly staff (you know who you are), we can't wait to visit and chat with you again. Great ambience. Great food. Great people. 
Keep it up!More

Name: THE PARK RESTAURANT, Darjeeling - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Whenever we visit Darjeeling that happens every year once or even sometimes twice, self and family have always ensured to relish the Thai/Chinese food atleast one Lunch if not more.

We have always carried wonderful memories of awesome food served here besides its ambiance but...today was the most HORRIBLE experiance.

Tom Yum Soup was made with just few common vegetables into the Chicken Stock with no sign of any herbs and any flavor - totally bland. It seems a lot of turmeric powder waa douses into it. Worst ever.

We askwd to change the same to Sweet Corn Soup but that never came rather the Lunch was served in a hurry so that we could thrown out faster.

Our Lunch order was Stir Fried Vegetables, Chilli Chicken with semi-gravy, Chicken Hakka Noodles and Vegetable Fried Rice. The food served was just Warm not Hot, the Chilli Chicken came on the table after we were almost through with our lunch. The gravy of Stir Fried Vegetables and Chilli Chicken was almost the same. Wherein the Stir fried vegetables was not at all appealing.

All the food items were tasteless - bland. 

We just ate to fill our hunger but certainly spoilt our enthu to enjoy our Lunch at The Park.

The manager was helpless with only word of sorry and an excuse that their Chef has changed hence they have complaints. The earlier ones have retired and left.

It is very sad that we always had a very good experiance and memories for excellent food served here but now we lost this to a road side standard one.

We will certainly not go back to this place anymore and would not recommend anyone to waste their money and appetite.

The owners must realize that the good Chefs of any restaurant will bring in business or repeate business not anyone else.

Wishing The Park with Good Luck.More

Name: THE PARK RESTAURANT, Darjeeling - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: It is one of my personal favourite. They have Thai and Chinese specialties. Very limited menu and tad slow service. But the food is very nice - especially the starter items. This time I didn't like much their main course items. Overall - it is...a must go if you are a Thai loving person.More

Name: PREGO, Mumbai - Goregaon - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Cusine: Vegetarian Friendly, Vegan Options, Gluten Free Options
Detail Review: I've been to this restaurant before in '19 when they had an Italian chef. It was my wife's birthday and we had our 3 month old daughter with us. That experience was so good that I knew that I had to come back here soon....Finally, in '22 a day before our 8th wedding anniversary, I decided to celebrate here once again with my family. Unfortunately, the first impression was less than favorable as the tables were very dusty and the staff at the beginning looked out of practice. However, this was soon made up by Ms. Anupa Peter who really floored us with her impeccable service. She not only took our orders, but had very valuable suggestions from the menu and with the wine selection too. Full Marks to her for keeping our little "almost 3 years old" engaged by getting her a coloring book, crayons and even gifting her a box of macaroons. Besides Anupa's service, the food was really good as well and I can certainly say that it lived up to my past experience. From the in house focaccia bread replete with the flavored butters to the espresso before the cheque,  everything was on point. The three stand out dishes were the quattro fromage pizza, the lamb  chops and the tiramisu. Lastly, a huge thanks to Chef Samir Karkare who made our celebration all the more special by serving us such a one off" wonderful dessert entirely made from  scratch and off the menu. It looked as beautiful as it tasted. Highly recommended for those special occasions.More

Name: PREGO, Mumbai - Goregaon - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

We visited Pergo for a dinner date. Everything was on point - right from the ambiance to the food to the staff. They serve authentic Italian delicacies. The pasta is freshly made. Spaghetti Aglio e Olio was super delicious. Their wood fired pizzas are a...must try. 
I must mention the impeccable services provided by Anupa Peter. She made us an out of the menu cocktail  topped with an eye-catching edible bubble. The drink was made according to our liking and we loved it.More

Quote: Great Italian food. Beautiful Indian service.
Detail Review:
Prego is truly passionate about their food quality and they deliver well by using authentic Italian ingredients. Every item we ordered whether it was a humble Mushroom soup or the Pizza Boscaiola with Parma Ham, Forest mushrooms and goat cheese or the Grilled Salmon that...was sheer deliciousness on a plate - Prego aced them all.

But what raised our dinner was the exemplary service and recommendations by Anupa P. She personally took note of our likes and dislikes before suggesting the dishes for our large group and I must say that every dish was on point. Even the cocktails that she recommended were fantastic and we repeated them. Her service is definitely going to bring us back to Prego again.More

Name: MERRY GO ROUND - REVOLVING RESTAURANT, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: I ordered Chicken Biriani and was very disappointed.  The meal was warm and the chicken dry.  There was no vegetables. The placing are set with a fork and spoon no knife. The drinks are listed on the menu at Rs80 each, thats when any thought of a tip evaporated into thin air.  A couple on a nearby table tried to order wine only to be told their selection was unavailable, and they only had premium wines.  A good restaurant would have gone the 800metres to the local alcohol shop and bought a bottle.More

Detail Review: I got the chance to have dinner here along with family. Each & every curry was perfectly cooked with very balanced spices. I liked their mixed veg preparation with naan & missi roti. Restaurant is fascinating while it takes you on a ride.

Name: MERRY GO ROUND - REVOLVING RESTAURANT, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: It was a mistake to visit
Detail Review:
My wife suggested that we have lunch in the revolving restaurant.
Very enthusiastic on a chilling day to go for a good lunch at a revolving restaurant we reached around 1.30 noon and found only both of us -which was good. 
We ordered soup along...with fried fish, club sandwiches & Russian salad to start with, but was very greatly dissatisfied with cold soup served in very dirty utensils which we had to return. Fish was without taste, probably old and was warmed in microwave . We could not eat that. The club sandwiches were 4 pieces of normal daily sliced bread of which even the corners were not cut.
The Russian salad was ok but served in a quarter plate, probably they had run out of the full plate.

No forks & knives on the table, the water glasses were stinking with raw eggs smell.

Top of it, the restaurant was not revolving & we had to request to start the revolving.

The only good person was the Gatekeeper at the entrance who was pleasant & helpful.

I will never visit it again.More

Name: MERRY GO ROUND - REVOLVING RESTAURANT, Agra - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Expensive and poor quality.More

Name: AGARWAL'S PURE VEG RESTAURANT, Puri - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We actually had a dinner at their VIP road branch. Clean and good food.  Most of dishes are available in no onion no garlic form as well.  Though due to Covid restrictions, many items were not available, yet we got what we were looking for.

Name: AGARWAL'S PURE VEG RESTAURANT, Puri - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Great food! Except only you need to be aware of the timings, so that you don't have to wait a lot. Mostly lunch starts beyond 12, so anytime before that you are looking at a longer wait time. But the food definitely compensates for everything.

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We had a lovely lunch here with delicious food and great service. The restaurant was buzzing. 

We had the Junglee Maas and the Mutton Galouti Kabab for starters with chilled beer to beat the afternoon heat. The Junglee maas dry preparation was so tender and...packed with flavour that we had to repeat it to satisfy our cravings

We ended a hearty meal by sharing two Handi Mutton Biryanis.

A must visit in JaipurMore

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Delicious! Don’t let the reviews on google put you off - this place is a gem. It was very busy when we left so might be worth going early. Enjoyed the meal - and was one of the first places in India I’ve been to...so far that a) sells Diet Coke and b) charges the same as the other soft drinks!More

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Do not miss the Jangli Maas!
Detail Review:
We got a personal recommendation from a friend to try the Jangli Maas (Mutton). Our expectations were not only met but exceeded. The first time I took a bite of Jangli Maas - the unique spices, the succulent - fall of the bone mutton- I...realized that this is quite different from any other mutton dish I have had. 

Please try for yourself :)More

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Handi is simply superb. The Junglee Maas is the one to have there. Handi was sooo good that we couldn’t help but go there in consecutive days for lunch. Also tried the Laal Maas and Handi Maas which were ok. But there is a suno...thing in this country like the Junglee Maas.More

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We enjoy Jungli Maas and Laal Maas with Bajra roti. The butter chicken and tandoori chicken is also good. The pieces were tender and had a great taste. The Hotel has Bar facilities also.

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: I want to again and again eating Rajasthani dishes because It's very much testy and many things in Rajasthan

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Good ambience and great food. 
Went there as per my foodie friend’s reference. It was our anniversary night also. 
Handi didn’t disappoint . 
The galouti kabab was succulent and tasty.
Although I got blown away by the dry Junglee Maas recipe. Amazing texture and taste....I have returned from Jaipur by the flavors will stay with me. The Long Island iced tea was balanced .

Definitely recommended.More

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We ordered their special Junglee Maas, Laal Maas and Bajre ki Roti and kulfi. Food was delicious and service was pretty good, although we went there very late for lunch around 3.30 and restaurant was jam packed still they served us pretty well. We like...all dishes.More

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Food at Handi was pretty decent. Nothing to write home about, but also nothing to complain about. Everyone says to get the laal mass, which we did, and it was good. A little too spicy but they toned it down for my elderly father after...he asked. Food does not feel authentic though.

The sizzler was very tasty too and even had an Italian flavor to it - not really what we intended to eat but it was good.

The service was okay; the power went out during our meal and we didn't really get any communication about it. But besides that the waiters were attentive. 

I'd go here if you couldn't get any other recs, but try to find a more local/authentic joint.More

Name: HANDI, Jaipur - M I Rd - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Quote: Most overrated food and pathetic service
Detail Review:
Visiting this restaurant has been on my list for sometime. Finally when I came for dinner, i was shocked to see the overall management of Restaurant. 
All staff were roaming around clueless.  To start with....
Table was literally sticky and dirty.
I had to ask...for water 3-4 times
My order was served wrong even with specific and simple instructions. Instead of Bajra roti, serve tandoori roti. But it's a big thing for the staff to understand. 
Dal makhni was very average, you get better one in Dhabas
Now we talk about Laal Maans ...may be they are just fooling tourists by giving worst prepared dish in Rajasthan. Laal maans for them is lot of spices with base of Masalas. They really need to go back and learn how to make laal maans. Shame on them for cheating people by charging exorbitant price for such bad food. 
It was my last visit. 
Please don't even think of going hereMore

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Tanatan in Dadar was a wonderful experience. This contemporary twist on Indian cuisine, located directly across from Shiv Sena Bhavan, is sure to raise some eyes. Tanatan is a terrific venue for dinner with your loved ones, featuring both outdoor and indoor seats, lovely decor,...mood, and the cherry on top: live music.

The dishes are a stunning, mouthwateringly excellent assortment of meats and fish served on plates suitable for kings. I really liked what Tanatan has to offer and would go again just to try more meals and have a nice evening.More

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Being a north Indian ,it's very difficult to find that taste in Mumbai.But since I had started dining at this place, tanatan has become one of my favourite restaurant in Mumbai.From ambiayto food and service,it's just wonderful.I had visited  there for dinner with a friend....It takes hardly 10mins walk from Dadar station West to this place. The ambiance is so warm with beautiful lights and comfortable indoor and outdoor sitting space.The palce is so welcoming.We had ordered a Mocktail for my friend which was Santra Mantra and for me the Cocktail was Thanda teekha which was a very refreshing drink for Summer.For Starters we had Banjara Murg tikka and Bhuna chaap which is my all time favorite and it  was excellent in taste.And for Mains we had Rajni goes wild which was basically surmai fish in gravy and it was served with rice.The flavor was very close to thai green curry. It was so creamy and awesome.Other one was Matka sarso murg which was well cooked and was tangi in taste,it was served with cheese garlic naan .If you going there pls try these dishes,Highly recommend.To end our dinner we had a Dessert which was Brownie with ice-cream.Thanks to Mr. Dilip for serving us and helping us to choose the fingerlicking food.More

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: This is one of the best place for foods lover.
Detail Review:
Tanatan resturant is located at Dadar, Shivaji park.
The chicken in Malwani Murgh should be tender, moist, and well-marinated to ensure that the flavors permeate the meat. Look for well-cooked chicken pieces that are juicy and flavorful.

Chicken tikka is made by marinating chicken pieces...in a mixture of yogurt and spices, including ingredients like ginger, garlic, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder. The marinated chicken is then traditionally cooked in a tandoor (clay oven) or grilled to perfection.
The chicken is usually cooked to perfection, tender and juicy, while the thick gravy adds a velvety and slightly chunky texture. The combination of soft chicken pieces and the thick, flavorful sauce provides a delightful mouthfeel.More

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
We had an amazing time at Tanatan Dadar. The ambiance of this place is simply surreal. We kicked off our dining experience by trying two of their signature cocktails, Painkiller and Daaru kum Jugaad.

For appetizers, we indulged in the mouthwatering Dal Pakwan Batasha with...Pani puri vodka and Murg ghee roast. This unique fusion of Pani puri was the best I've ever tasted.

The highlight of the evening was the "Dilli ki Galliyon se" dish, which consisted of Laccha Parathe served with a portion of Paneer Makhini and the most delicious Dal Makhni. It was a truly delightful combination. 

To conclude this amazing dining experience, we savored the Choco Lava Cake, a cake filled with rich chocolate and topped with a cherry. It was the perfect ending to our meal. And to complete the experience, we enjoyed a Paan, which left us with a satisfying feeling of a complete meal.More

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
A great and superb place with ample of sitting arrangement. It has lovely and a cheerfull atmosphere. The service was great and prompt and also the staff is courageous.  
I had ordered; 
Cocktails:- 
Blue Haiwan :- A hard rocking cocktail which was superb amazing and...litterally it was fabulously granished.
Santra Mantra :- A great cocktail to go with ... it is a mix up of vodka and orange juice. Was superb amazing.
Appetizers:- 
Bhuna Chaap:- Delicious mutton which was damm amazing and was marinated perfectly,  was great in taste.
Raunake Seekh :- Another delicious and juicy mutton seekh kebab which were too dmm delicious and amazing.
Main Course:- 
Laal Maas:- A great authentic rajasthani dish which was superb amaizng , it was meduim spicy and the mutton was cooked till perfection. 
Chicken Biryani:- One of the best ever I tried. It was fabulous and was really delicious. 
Dessert:- 
Stick Kulfi:- Another best dessert which we had and was garnished and served greatly. 

Overall had an amazing experience. Would really love to come again.More

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Visited here a couple of days back and it was such a wonderful experience. Let's see how it went.

Staff & Ambiance - Staff was pretty welcoming and polite. Loved the way they treated us. Mr. Aditya helped us with their specialities and recommended us...with their bestsellers. Ambience is pretty good, quite neat and clean. Live Music was the best part here. They have both Indoor & Outdoor Seatings. Indoor has Live Music & Outdoor has Live Screening. 

Food -
1. Dal Pakwaan Batasha with Pani Puri - This one was really good. Presented very well. Had Pani Puri Shots. 

2. Khow Suey Samosa - Had a really good flavour. It was dipped in a chilli mayo dip. 

3. Pahadganj wala Paneer with Cheese Garlic Naan - This combo was the best one. Quite filling. The Paneer was soft and flavourful. Loved it.

4. Matka Rabdi Gulab Jamun - Had a Gulab Jamun dipped in the Rabdi. Loved this dessert.

We also tried Kit Kat Freakshake which was really good. Topped with Whipped Cream and Kit Kat.

Overall it was a great experience. Loved it.More

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Food was okay compared to what they had charged. Also there were plenty vacant tables outside but the front desk staff were acting so pricy.

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: One the Best Place to have Indian Food in Shivaji Park
Detail Review:
Tanatan!!
Located in the prime location of Dadar Shivanji Park Just opposite to Seva Bhavan.

As soon as we enter the place, we get to see a lot of bells, Rustic look - Looks great. The interiors, wall art, tables - Amazingly done! Loved it....This place is  for all the Indian cuisine lovers. The best thing which I like here is live music, there was a band performing Bollywood songs. If you are looking for a place where you can eat delicious food and enjoy great music than I definitely recommend this restaurant.  

The staff here are polite and you can trust on their suggestions. Suggestions were really helpful. Service is great.

What We Ordered: 
Boutiful Bubble: The persetation was amazing and the taste was mixture of sweet and sour

Tanatan Sangria: The signature sangria with the perfect aroma and fruity touch

In starters-
Khow sey Samosa:  A new face to the samosa served in small cups dipped in coconut sauce. Unique and tasty. Highly recommend!!

Daal Pakwaan Batasha with Pain Pruri Vodka: one the Best Combo of Pani Puri in Vodka.

Mains:
 Veg Dilli ki Galliyo Se: Its a combo of  Paneer Makhanwa &, Smoky Daal Makhani and lachha paratha. It almost felt like the meal flew in from Delhi, very authentic and delicious.

Rajni Goes Wild: This consist of Rice with Coconut Curry Served with Pappad and Salad

Desserts:
Sticky Kulfi: It had amazing presentation of kulfi & taste was also amazing.

Overall I really enjoyed food over here!!More

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Name: TANATAN, Mumbai - Ground Floor Vidya Bhavan Near Sena Bhavan Dadar Shivaji Pk, South Mumbai - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Tanatan as the name suggest is really a tanatan place for all the Indian cuisine lovers. The place has a lot of vibe with excellent hospitality and delicious lip smacking Cuisines. They have a tinch of desi indian touch with their exotic masalas and flavourful...spices in their delicacies.
I had being here with my partner and enjoyed the live music, moody lights and what not.
I had tried-
In mocktails-
1. Thanda Teekha
An amazing conceptualized drink which is thanda when sipped but has a lot of after taste spiciness which is worth the try
2. Tanatan Sangria
The signature sangria with the perfect aroma and fruity touch
 
In starters-
3. Khow sey Samosa
A new face to the samosa served in small cups dipped in tomato and some masala salsa dip. Unique and tasty
4. Bharwa mirch Achaari Paneer tikka
The paneer cubes perfectly marinated with desi achaari and mirch sauces and cooked to perfection. The taste was wholesome and felt amazing.

Main course-
5. Firangi Nuska with Cheese garlic naan and butter roti
The best of the things that i tasted here and would highly recommend is this very special item. Exotic vegetables like bell peppers, zuchini, peas, babycorn and what not in a spiced cashew tomato gravy. This was really tempting

Desserts-
6. Gulkand cheese cake
Signature cheese cake topped with gulkand. Heavenly taste and satisfying.

Overall the experience was above amazing. The time spent here was really special with all the arrangements they had. Looking forward to visit again.

Name: ABSOLUTE BARBECUES - MGF METROPOLIS MALL, GURUGRAM, Gurugram (Gurgaon) - Menu, Prices & Restaurant Reviews - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Absolute Barbecues.
Firstly, we would like to say we have been to various barbecue outlets whether it's barbecue nation or castles barbecue. This outlet impressed us  with the variety that they have. Serving proteins such as emu, shark meat, uncultured bunny, duck, octopus. Having a...wide selection of cocktails and mocktails, as well as having a kids section where you can find McCain's and fries.
The best part about this barbecue is they have an ice cream counter where they make varietals as well as serving Mexican chilli ice cream.
We were impressed by the starters, but as soon as we arrived in main course and dessert, the taste and flavour wasn't upto the mark.
But for sure, you can try the proteins and enjoy their lip smacking cocktails.
But apart from the food, the very thing that we didn't like was the cleanliness of the restaurant, marks on the glass wall and the kind of crockery they used for soups and serving protein.
On Mondays & Tuesdays, dinner is served at 599 bucks whereas they serve lunch at the same price whole week.
Thank You!
.
Regards,
Cravers of Taste
(Chitra and Saharsh)More

Name: CASA BHONSLE BAR & RESTAURANT, Panjim - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Am always on the lookout for good fish thalis. This was recommend by a foodie to try out the thali. We get to Panjim for work and need to have a quick meal, in and out and thalis are the best option.
We were 5...of us. All got the same fish thali. And one extra masala fired fish.
The thali was great with the staples. Tasty prawn curry, and king fish fry.
Nice large place on top and was full for lunch. Reasonable prices, quick service. Definitely gong back again.More

Name: CASA BHONSLE BAR & RESTAURANT, Panjim - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
The restaurant is located centrally, on the first floor. There is sufficient public parking space near the restaurant, but finding a space to park on weekdays, especially during lunch time, is difficult.
The dining space was spacious, with soothing ambiance. The cleanliness and hygiene was...good. The service was reasonably quick. The restaurant was not crowded but had reasonable occupancy.
It is a multi cuisine restaurant, which served Veg and Non Veg dishes, though they specialise in Sea Food. The food here costly compared to some other restaurants nearby. However, the restaurant gives a fine dine experience, which justifies its pricing.
We, office colleagues, had visited for lunch and ordered Fish Thalis. The food appeared authentic and was appreciated by all, in our group.
Overall, a good option to have food at Panaji.More

Name: CASA BHONSLE BAR & RESTAURANT, Panjim - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
I was out shopping with the family and as dinner time approached decided to walk into Casa Bhonsle to satisfy my seafood craving.

We started out with Chicken Lollipop, Squids Batter fry and Rava fried Prawns. The starters came out piping hot and delicious and...disappeared in a jiffy washed down with Bira beer from the tap.

For mains we had Prawns Curry Rice with Chonak Rava Fry. A plate of Prawn Kismoor is given complimentary with The curry. The sea food was fresh and beautifully prepared. 

Desserts was caramel custard and Tender Coconut Souffle which was so yummy that we had a second helping.
 
We thoroughly enjoyed the meal.More

Name: B KITCHEN & BAR, Mumbai - Vile Parle West - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: A bar where the crème de la crème of the city gather to celebrate the amazing nightlife of B kitchen & bar. Given the space that it has, the bar is divided into two sections. There is an indoor seating, out-door seating, dance floor and...a huge bar. This place offers multiple cuisine with some delicious options for both vegans and non-vegans. . If you visit during the day, and are lucky then you will definitely find a celeb around in the bar for company. B kitchen and bar is located on the ground floor of the Legend Kishore Kumar’s Bungalow. A visit here won’t let you down for sure!More

Name: B KITCHEN & BAR, Mumbai - Vile Parle West - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
B Bar and Kitchen is Casual Dinning Restuarant In Juhu, Offering Continental and Lebanese Cuisine. It's Not Just Casual Dinning Restuarant you Would Know. They Have Huge Space In Restuarant Like Outdoor Section, Indoor Casual Dinning Section, Bar Area and Dance Floor. They Have Great...Menu Lines Up and Their Dishes Presentation is Awesome. 

Has I Was Here For Dinner Last Night With Friends. All My Friends And Me Had Wonderful Experience At B Bar & Kitchen. In Dinner I Tried and Liked Food Items are As Follows

1) Tandoori Mushroom Soup
Rich Creamy Frothy Tandoori flavored Mushroom Soups Served With Bread 

2) Baked Brie
Brie Stuffed in Phyllo, Topped With Fig-Jam and Truffle Scented Honey

3) Chicken & Black Olive
Chicken Supreme, Spinach, Black Olive Dust and Chipotle Mayo

4) Parmesan Chicken
Pan Seared Chicken Supreme Crumbled with Parmesan and Parsley

5) Broccoli Espuma
Refried Beans, Melted Cheese Topped With Broccoli Foam, and Sour Cream Served in Martini Glass

After Having So Many Small Plates & Soup With Friends, We Managed To Order Few Mains Which are Follows

1) Cottage Cheese Steak With Fennel Stew
Cottage Cheese Patty Served With Fennel Stew, Fennel Slaw and Topped With Pesto Sauce

2) Hauancaina Chicken
Grilled Chicken, Aji Amarilo Sauce, quinoa, dill and yogurt beam salad with sweet potato chips

After Having Mains We Had One Of Most Trending Desserts In House Which Has Follows

1) Campfire Stories
Which Includes 55% Dark Chocolate Espuma, Smores, Graham Cracker, Mint Semifreddo and 70% Dark Chocolate Sauce

All Our Dinner Was Had With Refreshing Mocktails Like Lost island And Paradian SummerMore

Name: B KITCHEN & BAR, Mumbai - Vile Parle West - Restaurant Reviews, Photos & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
What is better than having good surroundings of people around when you are traveling and exploring because those people are the add-on in your list it can be a lesson or experience but whatever it will be good for you no matter what.

I am...always in the learning phase of my life every single moment and at every single place. Blogging is passion and traveling to a different city every single day is giving me that content and experience to share it with all of you.

This time I was in Mumbai with clients having dinner at “B Kitchen” and here I am with another food blog about B kitchen food and experience I had in that Resturant. This place generally comes to the party after 10 pm so if you are visiting that place for a party make sure to visit after 10 pm. What I like most about this place is that cuisine from most part of the globe is available under one roof. This place is posh with a good crowd and spacious enough to not to feel suffocated. Open section with all the glass and dim lights looks amazing.

The Ambiance was amazing with proper and separate dining area, club area and Resturant area inside that also with good kind of crowd.

Music and Dj were good and loud as it’s normal for them but I believe Dj could play better and upgraded music but anyway it was fine.

Air Conditioning was so damn high and cool that we need to change our tables thrice just because of coolest AC temperature so any of you are a fan of minimum temperature should visit there once

Service was good and quick in terms of serving food and the staff was friendly too.

Services Available It would be better if I will explain you all in pointers to remember all the thing in order. I apologize if I am being a Teacher over here but I like things and human to be organized.

They Serve Alcohol
Keto Options are available not to worry
Serves Cocktail
Vegan Option for Vegan People
Smoking Area
Valet Parking
Private Dining Available
Table Booking Recommended
Restricted Entry
Wifi
Kids below 15 years are not allowed after 9 pm
Food Quality was good as we were 4 people 2 alcoholic and 2 nonalcoholics including me so we have so many drinks over the table.

Cuisine In terms of Cuisine they had

Mexican
Finger Food
European
Asian
Middle Eastern
Food and Drinks I had In B Kitchen

Virgin Mojito was very balanced in terms of sweetness and sourness as generally, this Mojito seems great everywhere but here it was the perfect combination.

Watermelon Drink was good too with normal sweetener and cool enough that we don’t need an extra ice in it along with a slice of lemon on top of the glass.

Garlic Bread We had Garlic bread which I found can be better or you can say I tried better Garlic Bread Version in other places so you can skip Garlic Bread.

Truffle Flat Bread An actually really flat white colour bread with lots of mozzarellas cheese and some cherries over the top along with some green leaves which looks like Kari Patta not really sure what kind of green leaves over there maybe you can check from the pictures I had do let me know in comment section about this leaf.

Falafel – Well I did not like it much because maybe it’s not my taste it was not that bad though I liked the Sauce with this Falafel. and most people gave good reviews about this dish and by the way, it is my boss favorite dish so he always orders Falafel wherever he goes.

Lasagna- This was the most delicious dish I have ever eaten because I love lasagna a lot but B Kitchen Lasagna won over any lasagna funniestMore

Name: BAKE & STEAM, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor

Bake & Steam has been a favourite of ours since it opened.  Great that the high standards are being maintained and that every dish on the very comprehensive menus is great.  Something for all tastes.

Name: BAKE & STEAM, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Food was good, excellent service, clean place, suggestions given by the waiters was very helpful, good ambience.

Name: BAKE & STEAM, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Dinner at Bake & Steam Resturant, Calcutta.
Detail Review:
After a break of over 2 years our foodie family went for dinner at Bake & Steam resturant at Calcutta.

The ambience is wonderful.. comfortable sitting arrangement ... the staff was friendly and polite and the food was great both in taste and quantity.. the...resturant serves both Continental & Indian delicacies.

We started with soups... Tomato & Basil, Cream of Chicken and Cream of Crab
followed by starters ... Fish Amritsari Tikka & Non veg Kabab Platter which consisted of chicken, fish, prawn & mutton items.

For the main course we had Fish Romanesco, Mac & Cheese Chicken, Bake & Steam Fried Chicken, Classic Lasagne Chicken & Chicken A La Kiev.

One intetesting item was Mutton Biriyani on Sizzler ... a new fusion food concept not tried earlier anywhere... the Delhi wala Butter Chicken was also different in taste..

After a long break we had a nice enjoyable family dinnerMore

Name: BAKE & STEAM, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
This is our second review for Bake and Steam and happy to report that the restaurant remains excellent.
All menu choices are great but the Tandoori Chicken is probably the best in the world. The restaurant ambiance is great and staff excellent.
We have also...taken advantage of frequent take-aways from Bake & Steam which are well packed and presented and equally excellent.
Keep it up Bake & Steam.More

Name: BAKE & STEAM, Kolkata (Calcutta) - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:

The ambience is warm and friendly with very good...service.
The menu is Indian and continental offering choices for most tastes.
The food is very, very, good. Very well prepared and presented.
We will be visiting again very soon and have already had take out food which is equally good.
Keep it up Bake & Steam.More

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: For the best malu food experience, including delicious fresh appams
Detail Review:
The most mind blowing part of this place is that it has remained absolutely unchanged for some 2 decades while almost everything around in Church St. has changed. 

Appam served fresh is the best part with the food. It’s an absolute luxury to get this....The starters were also delicious. Nethili fry we took couldn’t have been better. 
The gravies were not that fabulous though. We got the chettinad chicken which was a bit too watery. The mutton fry was better. I guess they could improve on overall taste with the gravies.More

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Nothing what it used to be
Detail Review: If you had been a visitor to Coconut Grove, Church Street prior to 2019 then it is going to be a big disappointment now. We had been a regular visitor to this place since 1993 onwards for excellent Appam Stew and other dishes. However, a...visit now after a few years turned out to be bad. The food what we ordered was served very ordinary or rather tasteless. The ladies washroom dirty and the restroom area being shared with a pub, an extension of the same restaurant.More

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Visited the restaurant after work. Very nice area and the restaurant was also nice. Good food and service!

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Visited this place after years for lunch  . They have two levels , the top floor has Kerala Cuisine and the ground floor is more like an Italian cuisine . We ordered for burgers and steak .. the food was well cooked and tasted good....Advice to the management is to have more staff during lunch hours . There was just a single person taking all the orders and serving all the tables . Cos of which we had to wait for a long time to even place our order .. 3 star rating mainly cos of the service.More

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Went for a dinner late night after visiting one of the pubs on MG Road. 
The place is good and have been visiting there for 15 long years.  They serve typically Kerala Style food which is  good for a palate. 

The service levels are maintained...very well over the years.
The Interiors are great and well maintained.More

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: We stopped for a quick lunch in between meetings, found the food quite good, the portion were good for one person. Its price a bit on the higher side. the place looked authentic. In all worth a visit for sure.

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Ordered chicken , squids and mushroom dry items. Chicken was tasteless. Squids were okay and mushroom was nothing but oil. I could squeeze out at least a small cup of oil from 1 plate of mushroom starter. Disappointed and left without having main course. And...the bill was 2K. 
Not worth the money and time. 
I wouldn’t recommend this restaurant.More

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Good food, bit pricey and no AC
Detail Review:
We went there on a Friday afternoon. The place is around 100 m from Brigade Road and Church Street junction. The place will give you a feeling of old Bengaluru restaurant. There is no AC and its almost open air in the middle of the...city and thats too almost at road level.
We ordered Appam, mutton stew and Fish fry. Food is just mouth watering and we liked it a lot. Even the service was prompt and efficient.
The price is a bit on higher side. Two people costed 1600.
Overall good place to try Kerala foodMore

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Food was average, typical keralite style preparation, not many inviting dishes for vegetarians. Overall light food on stomach but overpriced

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Small portions, not tasty. Very spicy even for those who are used to spicy food. Wine glasses are the tiniest you can imagine.

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Quote: Delicious Kerala Food in a Fine Location
Detail Review:
A restaurant with Tasty food with polite staff with grate service.  
Has a good range of Kerala Food and located in the main street.

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
The restaurant, set bang on the main street, is a lovely combination of both indoors and the outdoors. Potted palms, a faux coconut palm at the center of each table, waiters dressed in lungis give it a nice traditional ambience.  
Of all the food we...ordered, I highly recommend the Ulli Theeyal which is baby onions cooked in a spicy tamarind curry to go with soft Appams.
Semiya Payasam was to die for!! just the right amount of sweet, it was excellent.
The Idiyappam noodles were not as fine as in most places, so a bit of a letdown.
My friends who ordered Meen Vevichathu, raved about it.
Make an evening of it so you won't mind the price that is a wee bit on the higher side.More

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: I visit this place whenever I feel to have good kerala food. this is one restaurant serve many of the special kerala foods which we malayalis love

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review:
Traditional settings with fresh beautiful surroundings. 
Courteous staff and great service.
The food is delicious and mouth watering.
Had a wonderful time and yummy food.

Name: COCONUT GROVE, Bengaluru - 86 Spencer Building Church Street Mg Rd, MG Road - Restaurant Reviews & Phone Number - Tripadvisor
Detail Review: Excellent variety of food vegetarian and non vegetarian. Prepared with ample spices which brings a pleasant taste of the food to the palate. Family oriented, good service and outdoor atmosphere. Ample seating is available.
